TEXT.English: Excessive CT
Excessive I

Negative Trait "Budget is no object. I shall have a massive army at my disposal and everything I want. I am King, am I not?" Your people spend their lives frustrated with your abuses of power but because of their economic desperation, they will be quick to sign up for government jobs in construction and military enlistment. Overspending and a failure to invest wisely creates budgetary shortfalls. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]One less Commerce is generated by any plot that generates as much as 7 or more. [ICON_BULLET]All cities lose a base Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]All cities lose a percentage penalty to Commerce. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]An extra unhappiness in every city. [ICON_BULLET]All trade routes lose a percentage penalty to Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements generate less Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements upgrade much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements are much slower for your workers to build. [ICON_BULLET]Lawyer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists lose a Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Great Statesmen are less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed faster. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are constructed faster. [ICON_BULLET]Team Projects are constructed faster. [ICON_BULLET]You can draft a few more citizens than normal during a conscript action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is significantly reduced due to allowing numerous budget debts to go unpaid. [ICON_BULLET]Gain an extra result from each Goody Hut you explore.
Excessive II

Negative Trait "Budget is no object. I shall have a massive army at my disposal and everything I want. I am King, am I not?" Your people spend their lives frustrated with your abuses of power but because of their economic desperation, they will be quick to sign up for government jobs in construction and military enlistment. Overspending and a failure to invest wisely creates budgetary shortfalls. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]The threshold for a plot generating an additional Commerce drops from 7 to 6. [ICON_BULLET]All cities lose base Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]All cities lose a percentage penalty to Commerce. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]An extra unhappiness in every city. [ICON_BULLET]All trade routes lose a percentage penalty to Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements generate less Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements upgrade much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements are much slower for your workers to build. [ICON_BULLET]Lawyer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists lose a Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Each city loses one from it's Maximum Trade Routes. [ICON_BULLET]Great Statesmen are significantly less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are constructed significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Team Projects are constructed significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]You can draft a some more citizens than normal during a conscript action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is significantly reduced due to allowing numerous budget debts to go unpaid. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are trained faster.
Excessive III

Negative Trait "Budget is no object. I shall have a massive army at my disposal and everything I want. I am King, am I not?" Your people spend their lives frustrated with your abuses of power but because of their economic desperation, they will be quick to sign up for government jobs in construction and military enlistment. Overspending and a failure to invest wisely creates budgetary shortfalls. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]The threshold for a plot generating an additional Commerce drops from 6 to 5. [ICON_BULLET]All cities lose a significant amount of base Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]All cities lose a percentage penalty to Commerce. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]An extra unhappiness in every city. [ICON_BULLET]All trade routes lose a percentage penalty to Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements generate less Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements upgrade much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements are much slower for your workers to build. [ICON_BULLET]Lawyer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists lose a Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Each city loses one from it's Maximum Trade Routes. [ICON_BULLET]Great Statesmen are significantly less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are constructed significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Team Projects are constructed significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]You can draft a some more citizens than normal during a conscript action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is significantly reduced due to allowing numerous budget debts to go unpaid. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are trained faster.

Negative Trait "Budget is no object. I shall have a massive army at my disposal and everything I want. I am King, am I not?" Your people spend their lives frustrated with your abuses of power but because of their economic desperation, they will be quick to sign up for government jobs in construction and military enlistment. Overspending and a failure to invest wisely creates budgetary shortfalls. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]One less Commerce is generated by any plot that generates as much as 7 or more. [ICON_BULLET]All cities lose a base Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]All cities lose a significant percentage penalty to Commerce. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]An extra unhappiness in every city. [ICON_BULLET]All trade routes lose a percentage penalty to Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements generate less Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements upgrade much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements are much slower for your workers to build. [ICON_BULLET]Lawyer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists lose a Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Great Statesmen are less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are constructed significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Team Projects are constructed significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]You can draft a few more citizens than normal during a conscript action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is significantly reduced due to allowing numerous budget debts to go unpaid. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are trained significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Gain an extra result from each Goody Hut you explore.
Serious Commerce penalties. Wonders and Military are generated faster but people are malcontent.
TEXT.French: Pénalités commerciales graves. Les merveilles et les militaires sont générés plus rapidement, mais les gens sont mécontents.

TEXT.English: Expansive CT
Expansive I

Positive Trait "Only a large and populace nation can command great power. Land is the only real commodity." For players that race other nations to capture and develop as much real estate as they can as fast as they can, this trait is the perfect selection. It supercharges workers and settlers and even supports a larger empire with reduced size based maintenance factors. Your people, just as your leader, are impatient to branch out, so patient research and impressive works are less important here. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Food and Production. [ICON_BULLET]Settlers are trained much faster than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are trained significantly faster than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements organically upgrade twice as fast as usual. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are far faster at improving your territory. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions option, instability from the distance to capital is reduced. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all produce an extra base Food and Production. [ICON_BULLET]Upkeep from the Distance to Capital is reduced. [ICON_BULLET]Upkeep from Number of Cities is reduced. [ICON_BULLET]You get a bonus amount of Free Units derived from a small percentage of your overall Population. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest Cities are happier since your citizens feel a sense of accomplishment in a highly populated area. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed slower than normal since these large projects greatly delay expansion efforts. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all penalized with one less base Research. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all suffer from a percentage reduction to Research. [ICON_BULLET]Scientist and Doctor type Specialists spend their time supporting the frontier more and thus produce one less Research. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a little less defensible because your cities are constructed with haste.
Expansive II

[ICON_BULLET]Priest and Noble type Specialists promote expansive efforts more than studies and thus cost a Research each. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less defensible because your cities are constructed with haste.

[ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less defensible because your cities are constructed with haste.

Fast Development of the land and seeding of new cities
TEXT.French: Développement rapide des terres et ensemencement de nouvelles villes

TEXT.English: Financial CT
Financial I

Positive Trait "Nothing can't be bought so proper investments cannot fail to achieve victory." Few nations like to think their rulers waste the taxes that are collected and this one can show a nicely balanced budget that plans each measure of spending quite carefully to get the maximum results. The leader is a genius when it comes to finances but may shave corners in a few areas that could lead to some dangerous results for the nation. Regardless, wealth is clearly more easily obtained within these borders, which is an envious position to be in. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities produce a couple more base Gold. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Gold. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists produce an extra Gold. [ICON_BULLET]The cost of rushing buildings and units is reduced significantly. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all happier with greater wealth going around and more fiscal responsibility in government. [ICON_BULLET]The overall upkeep expense for this nation is reduced. [ICON_BULLET]More Great People are born here because financial opportunities to invest into personal achievements are more readily available. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are focused on wealth generation are faster to build. [ICON_BULLET]Merchant type Specialists generate an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave type Specialists give an additional Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital produces a small percentage more Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to wealth improvements are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Corporate Maintenance is reduced. Corporations benefit from more relaxed policies that help them get more out of their investments. [ICON_BULLET]Great Merchants are more likely to be born. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy times are a bit longer. It takes longer to figure out how to optimize spending in a new governmental structure. [ICON_BULLET]All Improvements take a lot longer to upgrade naturally since your nation refuses to budget for such projects until absolutely necessary. [ICON_BULLET]Workers take longer to place Improvements because they tend to get things done on a shoestring budget. [ICON_BULLET]All units receive a little less investment into training thus lose an Experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Shaving costs on defensive preparations leads to a slightly reduced City Defense Modifier. [ICON_BULLET]Espionage Defense is slightly reduced due to underspending on security monitoring. [ICON_BULLET]Your defenses are somewhat more easily bombarded due to cutting costs in material expenses when constructing your fortifications. [ICON_BULLET]It takes slightly more food to grow your cities. With less government funding for family support programs, there is more reluctance to raise children until the providers have more firmly established their careers. [ICON_BULLET]Slightly higher Crime rate. More wealth circulating in your communities means there is a bit more to commit crimes.

TEXT.French: Forte génération d'or. Les gens sont heureux que le leader utilise efficacement ses impôts. La réduction budgétaire entraîne une baisse de la qualité dans certains domaines tels que la formation et la défense.

TEXT.English: Foreigner CT
Foreigner I

Negative Trait "I know not everyone understands where I'm coming from here. But if you can see our nation the way I do, from the unique perspective I have here, you would understand why I support these policies." The people aren't entirely behind this Leader. He is an outsider, probably due to being born in another country, or from a severe minority, always suspicious of his intentions and resentful of his heritage. In some cases, this leader may be an outsider due to an unusual arrangement of loyalty to another nation. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Culture and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy Times are dramatically increased while Religious Anarchy periods are significantly longer. [ICON_BULLET]Units trained in the capital gain a percentage penalty to their starting Experience Points. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People emerge slightly slower here due to some lack of loyalty felt in the military. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are constructed slower since the people don't feel this leader has the right to spearhead this sort of domestic program. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a reduction in base Culture and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Your capital loses a percentage penalty to Food, Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Spy Type Specialists earn one less Gold, Research, Espionage and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital suffers a percentage penalty to Culture and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]You can conscript one less citizen with a draft action in a city. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders and Team Projects are faster to construct. Your leader is always looking for ways to build up how his people perceive him and therefore budgets more for this sort of project. [ICON_BULLET]Corporation Maintenance is reduced since your leader is against international tariffs. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic bonus. World leaders respect your mixed heritage and some may even feel they have a special inroad with you as a result. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign Trade Routes are much more profitable since you are strongly in favor of international trade-friendly policies.

[ICON_BULLET]Your capital loses a percentage penalty to Food, Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Spy Type Specialists earn one less Gold, Research, Espionage and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital suffers a percentage penalty to Culture and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]You can conscript fewer citizens with a draft action in a city. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders and Team Projects are significantly faster to construct. Your leader is always looking for ways to build up how his people perceive him and therefore budgets more for this sort of project. [ICON_BULLET]Corporation Maintenance is significantly reduced since your leader is against international tariffs. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a strong Diplomatic bonus. World leaders respect your mixed heritage and some may even feel they have a special inroad with you as a result. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign Trade Routes are much more profitable since you are strongly in favor of international trade-friendly policies.

Has difficulty with resistance to his authority and government doesn't function very well as a result. Others resist any changes he wishes to implement. National Pride is lacking (-Culture) and foreign sympathies leaves him blinded (-Espionage)
TEXT.French: A du mal avec l'opposition à son autorité et le gouvernement ne fonctionne pas très bien en conséquence. D'autres résistent à tout changement qu'il souhaite mettre en oeuvre. La fierté nationale fait défaut (-Culture) et les sympathies étrangères le rendent aveugle (-Espionnage)
TEXT.Russian: Îí èñïûòûâàåò òðóäíîñòè ñ ñîïðîòèâëåíèåì ñâîåé âëàñòè, è â ðåçóëüòàòå ïðàâèòåëüñòâî íå ðàáîòàåò äîëæíûì îáðàçîì. Äðóãèå ñîïðîòèâëÿþòñÿ ëþáûì èçìåíåíèÿì, êîòîðûå îí æåëàåò îñóùåñòâèòü. Íàöèîíàëüíàÿ ãîðäîñòü îòñóòñòâóåò (- îò êóëüòóðû) è ê òîìó æå îí ñëåïî ïðåêëîíÿåòÿ ïåðåä âñåì èíîñòðàííûì (- îò øïèîíàæà)

TEXT.English: Humanitarian CT
Humanitarian I

Positive Trait "Kindness and compassion are not optional. To be otherwise is to make all achievement worthless. Our people will be well taken care of and all others will envy this treatment." This truly good person is a Leader many would love to live under. His nation is well cared for and nurtured and he spends time considering how to make life better and longer for the citizens in his charge. As a result, the whole culture of the nation comes together in support of one another. They aren't very willing warriors, but if they do go to war, as it is sometimes necessary, they make sure to have the most competent sources of healing support available at the front. It can also be a little expensive to run a country this way, but usually a lot more population can be supported, which can make up for the costs. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your Cities are much Healthier. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer and Recon units gain the Humanitarian I Promotion for free. It enhances healing support skills for the unit and reduces local disease a little. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all Happier knowing their leader truly cares for their well-being. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are born a little faster in this uplifting nation. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are more stable on the Revolution option. [ICON_BULLET]Priest Type Specialists gain a Food each because they spend more of their time gardening for the community. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen, and Slave Type Specialists gain a Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Priest Type Specialists gain an additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest cities are happier because you are able to reach more people in need with support programs in the largest urban centers. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic bonus for being well known to have good intentions. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy somewhat reduced Crime levels. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy somewhat reduced Disease levels. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is higher as it can be expensive ensuring the adequate care of all citizens. [ICON_BULLET]Priest Type Specialists lose a Production each because they spend more of their time gardening for the community. [ICON_BULLET]Military Training Type Specialists generate a Gold less each. [ICON_BULLET]This nation suffers from more War Weariness because they value well-being and care about people. [ICON_BULLET]You can draft a few less citizens than normal with a conscript action. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military units take longer to train because many of your people are squeamish about violence and require more conditioning than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities resent being whipped to rush construction and training significantly longer than normal.

Strong Happiness and Health and well insulated against revolution and reduces both Crime and Disease. Powerful Healers. Takes a slight production hit for redirected efforts of kindness.
TEXT.French: Fort bonheur et santé et bien isolé contre la révolution et réduit à la fois le crime et les maladies. Guérisseurs puissants. Prend un léger coup de production pour rediriger les efforts de gentillesse.

TEXT.English: Hunter-Gatherer CT
Hunter-Gatherer I

Negative Trait "We were meant to live simply. Throwing off the balance of nature by trying to become more than our natural selves is bound to have severe and serious consequences. We must stay as simple and in harmony as possible, using only what we need and living only in the now." His heart is in the right place in thinking that Humankind is likely to eventually destroy itself and its planet by its own nature. Therefore urges his people to live simply, don't try to overly compete with one another and other nations, and treat the Earth with respect. While this may be a very good person, he doesn't make a solid competitor. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities produce a percentage less Gold, Research, Culture and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities produce a percentage less Production. Secondary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Great People are slower to be born here due to competition being frowned upon. [ICON_BULLET]All Wonder Types are slower to be constructed since this leader does not prioritize anything that will make his nation stand out. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities generate one less Research and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements are far slower to naturally upgrade since there is natural reluctance among the people to update to the latest technologies. [ICON_BULLET]Upkeep from the Number of Cities in your empire is higher. It costs more to minimize the impact of Humanity in a larger empire. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are less happy since urban living is more fast-paced than your people prefer. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from a penalty to Education. While those researchers on the cutting edge aren't begrudged, most people prefer to let it all go over their heads. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your citizens are Happier with their simplified lives. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all gain a percentage modifier to Food. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities benefit from slight reductions in both Air and Water Pollution.

A very humble leader who wishes to minimize the impact of his civilization. Fewer Great People, Slower wonders, Less Commerces and Production but a bit more Food and Reduced Pollution. Less Education.
TEXT.French: Un leader très humble qui souhaite minimiser l'impact de sa civilisation. Moins de gens formidables, des merveilles plus lentes, moins de commerce et de production mais un peu plus de nourriture et une pollution réduite. Moins d'éducation.

TEXT.English: Idealistic CT
Idealistic I

Negative Trait "There's no problems in MY empire! Everything's rosy over here! I'm quite certain everything is going perfectly according to plan..." Some people believe that if they imagine problems away, they won't really exist. That's how this Leader approaches challenges, and as a result, he runs an inefficient empire. He takes major upkeep hits for letting the organization go lax. The rosy attitude does well in diplomacy and often promotes a view on war that everything's going just fine (even when its not but it helps the public morale) and lackadaisical approach to assigning policies streamlines anarchy times. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your Cities all suffer a minor percentage penalty to Food, Production, and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Your Cities all suffer a minor percentage penalty to Gold, Research, Culture, and Espionage. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your units are more lackadaisically trained and start with a one less Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a little less defended since dangers are ignored. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer a touch more Crime. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer a touch more Disease. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities struggle with a tiny bit less Education. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all happier since the leader always paints a pretty picture of how things are. [ICON_BULLET]Overall Upkeep is reduced because this leader tends to underspend with the optimism that problems will take care of themselves. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is lower. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is lower. [ICON_BULLET]Corporation Maintenance is lower. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are happier because you like to heap praise on your leading metropolitan centers. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military units are slightly faster to train since training isn't taken as seriously.

Suffers penalties in almost all areas but minor ones, and gains a few benefits in the process, such as in diplomacy and happiness.
TEXT.French: Subit des pénalités dans presque tous les domaines sauf les mineurs, et gagne quelques avantages dans le processus, comme dans la diplomatie et le bonheur.

TEXT.English: Imperialist CT
Imperialist I

Positive Trait "Take what they have and make it your own. Establish proper governance in the foreign lands and the world falls like dominoes at your feet." With this leader, you may wish to let your neighbors expand and place their cities and grow while you focus instead on developing a devastating city attack force to take all their achievements right out from underneath them. Your people are envious and savagely willing and empowered to act on your goals of conquest. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Imperial I promotion to all Combatant units. Strong city attack modifier and some side benefits that help your units maintain new cities. Unique Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]Whenever you capture a city you instantly get a number of free defenders drafted from the population of that city, based on the number of citizens you can conscript. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities construct Siege based and Siege supporting buildings faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People Specialists gain an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that support and unlock Siege units are faster to research. [ICON_BULLET]Siege units gain extra free experience. [ICON_BULLET]Siege units are faster to train. [ICON_BULLET]Increase to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Lower Maintenance costs from Distance to Capital. Planning to conquer so much territory, your people are more efficient at maintaining larger empires with larger areas. [ICON_BULLET]Lower Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a bonus amount of Free Military Units from the total population of your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain more experience when trained in your capital. Your seat of power is the beating heart of the will to dominate all foes. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are more likely to capture defeated enemy units due to their practice at establishing dominance and control over the defeated. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are less likely to be captured when defeated because they are too used to being dominant and cannot stand the idea of such submission. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Slightly reduced rate of birthing Great People since your culture is so focused on taking the achievements of others they tend to undervalue personal achievements. [ICON_BULLET]Takes a diplomatic penalty because few foreign powers are comfortable knowing that this leader's goal is to take over the world. [ICON_BULLET]Units are slightly more expensive to upgrade because keeping up on the specialized invasion training can get costly. [ICON_BULLET]Crime is more difficult to control since so many among your society feel dominated and resentful of it.

[ICON_BULLET]Moderate increase to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Lower Maintenance costs from Distance to Capital. Planning to conquer so much territory, your people are more efficient at maintaining larger empires with larger areas. [ICON_BULLET]Lower Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a bonus amount of Free Military Units from the total population of your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Each military unit you staff in a city makes your citizens happier. Strong City Attack forces and a government that is well structured for conquest.
TEXT.French: Des forces d'attaque de la ville fortes et un gouvernement bien structuré pour la conquête.

TEXT.English: Industrious CT
Industrious I

Positive Trait "Industry drives the strength of the nation." This leader considers productivity to be the highest priority a nation can have and does all he can to drive his people to greater industrial achievement. Like any of the yield and commerce focused traits, it's a simple strategy, but shockingly effective. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]An additional Production is generated by any plot that generates as much as 7 or more. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain an additional base Production. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Production. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Production focused improvements generate an additional Production. [ICON_BULLET]Production focused improvements upgrade twice as fast as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Production focused improvements are much faster for your workers to build. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate an additional Production. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that bring improvements to industry are faster to research. [ICON_BULLET]Your workers are faster at building improvements overall. [ICON_BULLET]Great Engineers are more likely to be born. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Less Health in each city since heavier industry often invites more injury causing accidents. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate one less Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers a bit more Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers a bit more Water Pollution.
Industrious II

Positive Trait "Industry drives the strength of the nation." This leader considers productivity to be the highest priority a nation can have and does all he can to drive his people to greater industrial achievement. Like any of the yield and commerce focused traits, it's a simple strategy, but shockingly effective. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]The threshold for a plot generating an additional production drops from 7 to 6. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain some additional base Production. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Production. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Production focused improvements generate an additional Production. [ICON_BULLET]Production focused improvements upgrade twice as fast as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Production focused improvements are much faster for your workers to build. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate an additional Production. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that bring improvements to industry are faster to research. [ICON_BULLET]Your workers are faster at building improvements overall. [ICON_BULLET]Great Engineers are significantly more likely to be born. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Less Happiness in each city since harder, longer work dulls the enjoyment in life. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate one less Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers some more Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers some more Water Pollution.

TEXT.English: Innovative CT
Innovative I

Positive Trait "Our nation should be a forerunner, creating and discovering new and valuable things to share with the rest of the world at a profit." Previously known as 'Progressist', this leader is enamored by new things and quickly tires of 'yesterday's news'. This can be problematic for the leader on an interpersonal level but it serves his people rather well, who are inspired to press the bounds of known design and function and to apply the latest developments as quickly as they can nation-wide. As a result, the nation always has neat things to trade to other countries and between its own cities, and its always on the lookout for a way to impress the world with new wondrous things, including buildings. All this does enhance the overall upkeep expenses a bit. The leader and his people can also suffer some from impatience. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Research and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Production and Commerce. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your units can upgrade wherever they are as long as they do have access where they are to any required buildings and resources. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain an additional base Research and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain an additional base Production and Commerce. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Overall Upkeep is higher as operating a nation on the constant cutting edge makes for an expensive policy. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are slower to be constructed since they aren't as impressive since all nations can get something like it. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation accumulates War Weariness faster since war can distract from innovation. [ICON_BULLET]Anarchy time when changing Civics is a little longer since the impatience your people have for policy changes, and the constant suggestion of new ways to address little issues that a new policy introduces, adds to the frustration to getting things smoothed out. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements upgrade much slower than normal because the people are impatiently waiting for workers to get it done immediately rather than taking the time themselves to update the land they operate themselves. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are a bit slower because they are always looking for ways to do things in a new and improved fashion and have a hard time focusing on repetitive processes involved in getting things done. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation gets fewer base free military units because even your soldiers balk at getting hand-me-down equipment. [ICON_BULLET]The constant need to make sure that everything is as fully considered for new adjustments during times of policy change ensures that any Anarchy Period takes at least a round at minimum, which may be adjusted by game speed.
Innovative II

Positive Trait "Our nation should be a forerunner, creating and discovering new and valuable things to share with the rest of the world at a profit." Previously known as 'Progressist', this leader is enamored by new things and quickly tires of 'yesterday's news'. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign Trade Routes are more profitable. [ICON_BULLET]Cities start with a little culture. TEXT.English: Isolationist CT
Isolationist I

Negative Trait "All those other nations are only out to take advantage of us and even their trades are barbed with deception and entrapment!" Some nations throughout history have thrived with a xenophobic focus on themselves and internal matters and doing their best to block out the rest of the world and its affairs. This leader certainly tries this approach as much as possible and has convinced his people to adopt similar views. They frown on travel and tourism and are a defensive breed. This serves them in many ways but also impedes the nation from benefiting much from trade. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All Trade Routes are significantly less productive with yields generated. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities may maintain one less Trade Route than the normal limit. [ICON_BULLET]All Foreign Trade Routes are even less productive with yields generated. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Merchant Type Specialists generate one less Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Trade Units are trained with one less Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Trade Units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Civic changes cause more rounds of Anarchy as cooperation is not a cultural strong suit here. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is increased since your people don't like to travel. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from the Number of Cities is increased since your people prefer a smaller nation with fewer cultural differences and the wider they are spread, the more they conflict internally, leading to unique support costs. [ICON_BULLET]Each of your cities lose a Trade Route. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic penalty with other Leaders since you simply don't like spending time with them and would prefer they stay home rather than visit. [ICON_BULLET]Loses some Tourism in all your cities. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great Generals are faster to emerge from battles in your borders since your people are more deeply offended by intrusions. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are faster to construct since anything intended to support the nation is a higher priority than usual. [ICON_BULLET]An additional citizen may be drafted during a conscription action. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain more experience during combat inside your borders since your people are highly territorial. [ICON_BULLET]Cities have higher City Defense levels since they are cleverly designed to keep others out. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are harder to perform Espionage Missions in for your enemies. Your xenophobic citizens rarely offer any trust to outsiders.
Isolationist II

Negative Trait "All those other nations are only out to take advantage of us and even their trades are barbed with deception and entrapment!" Some nations throughout history have thrived with a xenophobic focus on themselves and internal matters and doing their best to block out the rest of the world and its affairs. This leader certainly tries this approach as much as possible and has convinced his people to adopt similar views. They frown on travel and tourism and are a defensive breed. This serves them in many ways but also impedes the nation from benefiting much from trade. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All Trade Routes are significantly less productive with yields generated. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities may maintain a few less Trade Routes than the normal limit. [ICON_BULLET]All Foreign Trade Routes are even less productive with yields generated. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Merchant Type Specialists generate one less Food. [ICON_BULLET]Trade Units are trained with one less Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Trade Units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Civic changes cause more rounds of Anarchy as cooperation is not a cultural strong suit here. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is increased since your people don't like to travel. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from the Number of Cities is increased since your people prefer a smaller nation with fewer cultural differences and the wider they are spread, the more they conflict internally, leading to unique support costs. [ICON_BULLET]Corporation Maintenance is increased since your people are terrible at selling their products, preferring to be as impersonal as possible. [ICON_BULLET]Each of your cities lose a Trade Route. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic penalty with other Leaders since you simply don't like spending time with them and would prefer they stay home rather than visit. [ICON_BULLET]Loses some Tourism in all your cities. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great Generals are faster to emerge from battles in your borders since your people are more deeply offended by intrusions. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are faster to construct since anything intended to support the nation is a higher priority than usual. [ICON_BULLET]An additional citizen may be drafted during a conscription action. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain more experience during combat inside your borders since your people are highly territorial. [ICON_BULLET]Cities have higher City Defense levels since they are cleverly designed to keep others out. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are harder to perform Espionage Missions in for your enemies. Your xenophobic citizens rarely offer any trust to outsiders.

TEXT.English: Megalomaniac CT
Megalomaniac I

Negative Trait "I was born to rule the Earth! None shall stand in my way! Advisors? Bah! Nobody knows better than I!" Some of your people may be enamored with this leader's unshakable projection of confidence. But one of the problems in the world is that stupid people have the confidence to take the lead while the intelligent ones are often too cautious with responsibility. This nation suffers from overspending and impulsiveness and an inability to get their leader to see reason when it can be desperately important that he understands he doesn't have all the answers all the time. Intelligent people who live under this rule are deeply embarrassed by this leader. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Gold and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Food and Production. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Overall upkeep is a little increased due to unwise spending and policies. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders and Team Projects are slower to construct since sharing in the glory of an accomplishment and construction projects that support local needs are not inspiring to this leader. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a reduction in base Gold and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a reduction in base Food and Production. [ICON_BULLET]Gains a penalty to Diplomacy. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are easier to perform espionage missions against since your leader often publicizes secrets in the act of bragging. [ICON_BULLET]Your people take more time in resent for being whipped to rush constructions and training during slavery since many do not approve of the leader's choices in the first place. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer a little more from Crime since the people are resistant to this leader's laws. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great People are slightly faster to be born because the people are inspired to have confidence in themselves. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People emerge slightly faster because the military gets frustrated with being led poorly so those who want to improve things rise to the occasion faster. [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are faster to build since the leader loves to budget for anything that assuages his ego. [ICON_BULLET]Anarchy time when changing Civics is significantly shorter since this leader does not tolerate delays in his policy decisions. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are faster to train since the leader pushes his training programs with immense impatience.
Megalomaniac II

TEXT.English: Nomadic CT
Nomadic I

Positive Trait "Keep moving! Whether we are the cheetah or the gazelle, we run to survive. You can take whatever you want as long as you are faster than your opponent. Speed is key." Your leader's wanderlust has driven its way into every corner of society, making your people highly mobile and thriving when they can stay on the move, but suffering when they must settle. They are more in touch with the land and seasons and love tending to herds and hunting for food. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Nomadic I Promotion for Explorers, Animals, Mounted, Trade, and Wheeled units. Gives enhanced land speed, terrain navigation and withdrawal skill. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Herding and hunting based buildings are faster to build. [ICON_BULLET]Camps, herding and hunting improvements are more valuable. [ICON_BULLET]Animal qualifying improvements are much faster to upgrade if they can. [ICON_BULLET]Animal qualifying improvements are faster for workers to build. [ICON_BULLET]Great Hunter Specialists gain an additional Food yield. [ICON_BULLET]Great Hunter Specialists gain two additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that lead to Animal related or Speed related benefits are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Explorer, Animal, Mounted and Wheeled units gain extra experience points when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Explorer, Animal, Mounted and Wheeled units are faster to train. [ICON_BULLET]Less Distance to Capital upkeep. The speed at which your people travel reduces shipping costs. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain an additional trade route thanks to the speed and efficiency with which your people make trade journeys. [ICON_BULLET]Great Hunters are birthed faster. [ICON_BULLET]Many resources derived from land animal plots give extra happiness in all your cities. Your people love the bounty of the land and maintaining healthy wildlife populations. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Happiness penalty. It can be a hard life always being on the move and that gets to some at times. [ICON_BULLET]Plots that produce 5 Production or more generate one less. There's not as much concentrated focus on perfecting obtaining benefit from a given territory in less sedentary people. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that lead to more Sedentary specialized benefits like farming and mining are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. The more places there are in your nation, the more the infrastructure between them is of paramount importance to maintain to a high degree. [ICON_BULLET]Cities are harder to defend since people are more transient between them and don't place as much priority on local security measures.
Nomadic II

Positive Trait "Keep moving! Whether we are the cheetah or the gazelle, we run to survive. You can take whatever you want as long as you are faster than your opponent. Speed is key." Your leader's wanderlust has driven its way into every corner of society, making your people highly mobile and thriving when they can stay on the move, but suffering when they must settle. They are more in touch with the land and seasons and love tending to herds and hunting for food. [ICON_BULLET]Significantly less Distance to Capital upkeep. The speed at which your people travel reduces shipping costs. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain an additional trade route thanks to the speed and efficiency with which your people make trade journeys. [ICON_BULLET]Great Hunters are birthed significantly faster. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Happiness penalty. It can be a hard life always being on the move and that gets to some at times. [ICON_BULLET]Plots that produce 5 Food or more generate one less. There's not as much concentrated focus on perfecting obtaining benefit from a given territory in less sedentary people. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that lead to more Sedentary specialized benefits like farming and mining are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. The more places there are in your nation, the more the infrastructure between them is of paramount importance to maintain to a high degree. [ICON_BULLET]The largest cities in your nation are less happy. Your people don't like being crowded into high density spaces. [ICON_BULLET]Cities are harder to defend since people are more transient between them and don't place as much priority on local security measures.

Fast units but lagging cities. Animal resource focus.
TEXT.French: Unités rapides mais villes en retard. Accent sur les ressources animales.

TEXT.English: Organized CT
Organized I

Positive Trait "A well ordered hierarchy established throughout the nation will lead to streamlined efforts and balanced budgets." Everything is done in a careful and well planned manner here. This can slow things down but also leads to extreme efficiency in providing quality services to the nation. The most powerful aspect of this trait is how greatly it diminishes upkeep costs. Your military is a bit more restrained than it should be and therefore suffers for your organizational efforts. The longest projects are made faster with this approach and overall, more tends to get done by your people. Putting such a high value on planning and execution does diminish creativity some. Obviously some trying times of preparation can take longer since your government is instructed to do what it must to prepare for new ways to be introduced. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Overall Upkeep is strongly reduced. [ICON_BULLET]All specialists give an extra Production. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is tremendously diminished. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is hugely reduced. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Team Projects are completed significantly faster since proper planning at the beginning of the project leads to efficiencies that help the project finish ahead of time. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements naturally upgrade far faster due to preparations for improvement being taken all along. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are much faster at building improvements since things are well planned out before they even begin. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a number of Free Units that require no support. [ICON_BULLET]You gain yet more Free Units that require no support from a small percentage of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are happier than normal due to impressive urban planning making life easier on its citizens. [ICON_BULLET]Military Units are faster to train because the training regimen is so well planned out. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]It takes a bit more experience for your units to level and thus gain promotions. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are somewhat slower to emerge since your people rarely take inspired action without careful consideration. [ICON_BULLET]Artist and Slave type Specialists are less inspired so produce one less Culture each. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy time is longer due to the patient planning your leader insists on being taken with any policy changes.
Organized II

Positive Trait "A well ordered hierarchy established throughout the nation will lead to streamlined efforts and balanced budgets." Everything is done in a careful and well planned manner here. This can slow things down but also leads to extreme efficiency in providing quality services to the nation. The most powerful aspect of this trait is how greatly it diminishes upkeep costs. Your military is a bit more restrained than it should be and therefore suffers for your organizational efforts. The longest projects are made faster with this approach and overall, more tends to get done by your people. Putting such a high value on planning and execution does diminish creativity some. Obviously some trying times of preparation can take longer since your government is instructed to do what it must to prepare for new ways to be introduced. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Overall Upkeep is strongly reduced. [ICON_BULLET]All specialists give an extra Production. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is tremendously diminished. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is hugely reduced. Gains a highly lubricated government. Low upkeep and faster results. Leader and his followers are not as mentally agile so since war is chaotic it is irritating to the habit driven people, and it takes longer to reorganize the government properly after a change in policies.
TEXT.French: Obtient un gouvernement hautement lubrifié. Faible entretien et résultats plus rapides. Leader et ses partisans ne sont pas aussi agiles mentalement, donc comme la guerre est chaotique, elle est irritante pour les gens qui ont des habitudes, et il faut plus de temps pour réorganiser correctement le gouvernement après un changement de politique.

TEXT.English: Philosophical CT
Philosophical I

Positive Trait "What is life for? Are we not here to discover our true purpose and live that purpose? We were all born for a reason, born to contribute something special. We should support and enable each other to bring each other's unique gifts to bear for the nation." Your leader is a deep thinker who inspires the nation to produce individuals of the same nature. Some may suspect him of being a member of an elite secret society, and he may be. He certainly offers as much national support to the development of those with promise as he can. Unfortunately, smarter citizens are more likely to commit crime, thinking it to be a great way to test their intelligence against the system. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great People are born much faster in this nation. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Research and Gold. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists produce an extra Commerce. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities get a Free Specialist for each National Wonder constructed there. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities get an additional base Research and Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer Type Specialists give an extra Production. [ICON_BULLET]All cities get a few more Great People rate points each round, not dedicated to any particular type of specialist. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Overall upkeep is higher due to some unusual programs supporting grants and other independent efforts that show promise. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave Type Specialists lose the extra Commerce all other specialists give. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy periods last a little longer since more thought goes into trying to find the best ways to establish policy. [ICON_BULLET]The unhappiness from whip rushing construction and training lasts longer here than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Since people here often try to take longer to establish themselves in their careers before forming families, cities take more food to grow. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from extra Crime rates since even those with criminal minds feel empowered to find their calling as well.
Philosophical II

Positive Trait "What is life for? Are we not here to discover our true purpose and live that purpose? We were all born for a reason, born to contribute something special. We should support and enable each other to bring each other's unique gifts to bear for the nation." Your leader is a deep thinker who inspires the nation to produce individuals of the same nature. Strong Great People Growth and improved specialists. Deep thought is encouraged (+Research) and the financially elite are in favor in governmental policy so are happy to invest (+Gold)
TEXT.French: Forte croissance de Personnages Illustres et de spécialistes. Une réflexion approfondie est encouragée (+ Recherche) et l'élite financière est favorable à la politique gouvernementale et est donc heureuse d'investir (+ Or)

TEXT.English: Politician CT
Politician I

Positive Trait "Government is a complex machine, which requires constant tweaking and adjusting to get the best performance. The most adaptable government will survive." If you really hate anarchy periods after changing civics, this is your go-to pick. And although you will have very strong culture and espionage, you will also suffer from greatly increased maintenance struggles. Diplomacy with other leaders is also a strong suit. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Culture and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Anarchy Time from changing Civics is dramatically reduced. [ICON_BULLET]Units trained in the capital gain a percentage adjustment to their starting Experience Points. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are constructed significantly faster since they are a reflection of good governing. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain an extra base Culture and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Your capital gets a small percentage bonus to Food, Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Spy Type Specialists gain an extra Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital gains a percentage modifier to Culture and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic bonus. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]General Upkeep is significantly higher since this leader finds it very important to uphold all of his many promises to his people. [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are significantly slower to construct since such projects are always secondary in priority to more local needs being met first. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates faster for this nation, which likes to believe that proper governing involves avoiding warfare. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Palace is higher due to never shortcutting on costs to keep the government running at peak condition. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher since the costs normally associated with this upkeep are intensified by attempts to spare no expense for quality results. [ICON_BULLET]This nation suffers a small Education penalty. True politicians are a little too aware that citizens are more easily swayed when not as Educated.

Very good at minimizing/eliminating anarchy from civic changes. Good diplomacy and is compelled to present the nation as a leader on the international scene (+culture) and is savvy of other leader's machinations (+Espionage). Spends more on upkeep to ensure the best possible governmental functioning.
TEXT.French: Très bon pour minimiser / éliminer l'anarchie des changements civiques. Bonne diplomatie et est obligé de présenter la nation comme un leader sur la scène internationale (+ culture) et est averti des machinations des autres leaders (+ espionnage). Dépense davantage pour l'entretien afin d'assurer le meilleur fonctionnement gouvernemental possible.

Õîðîø êàê äèïëîìàò è âûíóæäåí ïðåäñòàâëÿòü íàöèþ â êà÷åñòâå ëèäåðà íà ìåæäóíàðîäíîé àðåíå (+ ê êóëüòóðå), è ðàçáèðàåòñÿ â ìàõèíàöèÿõ äðóãèõ ëèäåðîâ (+ ê øïèîíàæó). TEXT.English: Populist CT
Populist I

Positive Trait "Societal elite are all in cahoots with each other forming a master plot to take over all sovereign nations for themselves and only I seem to understand this!" It may seem strange that any leader would want to ensure that people in his society don't try to stand out as strongly valuable contributors but when people of high quality come under immediate suspicion of being potential threats, rivals, and conspirators, folks tend to keep a low profile and achieve more silently if at all. That's what happens in this leader's nation, but on the plus side, the truly common person actually does benefit a bit more from some of the programs designed to benefit the masses, so long as they stay in their lanes. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Great People are born much slower in this nation. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Research and Gold. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists cost one Commerce. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities get a reduction in base Research and Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer Type Specialists lose a Production. [ICON_BULLET]All cities get one less Free Specialist. Nobody wants to stand out for doing more than their fair share. [ICON_BULLET]All cities have their Great People accumulation points reduced by a few. [ICON_BULLET]Education levels are somewhat penalized. Your citizens are conditioned to feel that being overly educated is a form of arrogance that attracts the wrong kind of attention. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]General Upkeep is reduced since the funds usually channeled to elite members of society and education grants are withheld. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave Type Specialists gain back the Commerce all other specialists lose. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy periods don't last quite as long since fewer people feel they should contribute to the policy debates. [ICON_BULLET]You can draft an extra citizen than normal since people are happy to abandon individualism to be a part of something greater than themselves. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are a bit happier since urban living allows folks to blend into the crowd more easily. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities require a little less food to grow as your citizens tend to have larger families. The more the merrier. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from somewhat reduced Crime levels.
Populist II

Positive Trait "Societal elite are all in cahoots with each other forming a master plot to take over all sovereign nations for themselves and only I seem to understand this!" It may seem strange that any leader would want to ensure that people in his society don't try to stand out as strongly valuable contributors but when people of high quality come under immediate suspicion of being potential threats, rivals, and conspirators, folks tend to keep a low profile and achieve more silently if at all. That's what happens in this leader's nation, but on the plus side, the truly common person actually does benefit a bit more from some of the programs designed to benefit the masses, so long as they stay in their lanes. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Great People are born much slower in this nation. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Research and Gold. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists cost one Commerce. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People emerge more slowly here. [ICON_BULLET]All cities get a reduction in base Research and Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Law Type Specialists lose a Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]All cities get one less Free Specialist. Nobody wants to stand out for doing more than their fair share. [ICON_BULLET]All cities have their Great People accumulation points reduced. [ICON_BULLET]Education levels are somewhat penalized. Your citizens are conditioned to feel that being overly educated is a form of arrogance that attracts the wrong kind of attention. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]General Upkeep is reduced since the funds usually channeled to elite members of society and education grants are withheld. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy periods don't last as long since fewer people feel they should contribute to the policy debates. Great People rates and specialists are impacted heavily here. Experts are disdained (-Research) and the Wealthy are compelled to keep a low profile (-Gold) but this keeps government streamlined for the people's needs somewhat.
TEXT.French: Taux des Personnages illustres et des spécialistes sont fortement impactés ici. Les experts sont dédaignés (-Recherche) et les riches sont obligés de garder un profil bas (-Or) mais cela maintient le gouvernement rationalisé pour les besoins des gens quelque peu.

TEXT.English: Protective CT
Protective I

Positive Trait "Allow your cities to fall and your nation will follow. None shall pass through these walls!" Many civilizations will break their teeth trying to take your cities. Go ahead and provoke them to get the most out of your benefits, and keep the fighting within your own borders as much as possible. If you're playing a tough level and fear opponents that are far ahead of you in technology, this trait should help you feel much more secure, as it does your citizens. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Protective I promotion to all Combatant units. Strong city defense modifier and an extra benefit. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities gain a base defensive modifier due to complex strategic preparations always established and in place. [ICON_BULLET]Defenses in your cities are tougher to diminish with bombardments. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the rate of earning Great Military People when the battle takes place inside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities construct Defensive buildings faster. [ICON_BULLET]Defensive buildings make your people happier. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People Specialists gain two additional Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that form prerequisites for Defensive buildings are faster to research. [ICON_BULLET]Increase to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a bonus amount of Free Military Units from the total population of your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Each military unit you staff in a city makes your citizens happier. Your people are only satisfied when national defense is an obvious priority - you've made that one of your most solid vows to them. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain more experience when the battle takes place within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]It is more difficult for your opponents to perform espionage missions against you. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are somewhat less beneficial in terms of yields. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are a little less beneficial in terms of commerces. [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the amount of War Weariness you suffer. Anxiety about the quality of your defenses, likely to be tested during war, is very much the reason you and your people so good at ensuring it. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Distance to Capital because a well defended network of cities is a tighter network and defensive building materials are often very heavy. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. The larger the nation and the more centers to protect, the harder it is to plan the defenses for. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are less lengthy. You and your people take everything very seriously and are thus less jubilant for fear of letting down your guard.

Strong city and domestic defenses and military benefits but it all comes at some expense.
TEXT.French: De solides défenses urbaines et nationales et des avantages militaires, mais tout cela coûte cher.

TEXT.English: Revolutionary CT
Revolutionary I

Positive Trait "Freedom is our heritage and our right. Freedom enables the purest expression of each individual to become his highest self. This creates a strong nation." This Leader earned his position with a strong grass-roots movement, sometimes a violent one, driven by the frustrations of the people. He is held up as the solution that will bring the change they all feel they need. A lot of hopes ride on this individual. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen Type Specialists gain an extra Production. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are happier since people feel you are leading them to a better lifestyle. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are significantly faster to construct since there is a strong sense of national pride under this leadership. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions option, your cities are more stable and less likely to revolt. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities gain an extra base Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital gains a percentage modifier to Food, Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital gains a percentage modifier to Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness is significantly reduced. Your people are prepared to fight for their country. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are trained faster in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are harder to perform Espionage Missions against as they are more alert, knowing the national plans go against the grain. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are harder to capture by enemies that defeat them as they are fiercely loyal to the cause. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]General Upkeep is higher since upholding his promises to the people can be expensive. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy times are longer since your people have deep disagreements on what policies will be best to move forward with. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic penalty for being headstrong and projecting a willingness to fight for what you want. [ICON_BULLET]Anger from whip rushing constructions and training lasts significantly longer than normal since the people feel deeply betrayed by this act. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign trade routes are less profitable since other nations see you as an upstart they don't want to trade as agreeably with. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from a bit more Crime since rebels are empowered by your cause.

Good Happiness, Strong Specialists, Extremely good at avoiding revolt. A little less productive but compensates when building military. Extra expenses in setting up government. National Pride is high (+Culture) and innovative traders are enjoying their new freedoms (+Gold)
TEXT.French: Bon bonheur, spécialistes solides, extrêmement bon pour éviter la révolte. Un peu moins productif mais compense lors de la construction militaire. Dépenses supplémentaires pour la mise en place du gouvernement. La fierté nationale est élevée (+ Culture) et les commerçants innovants profitent de leurs nouvelles libertés (+ Gold)

TEXT.English: Scientific CT
Scientific I

Positive Trait "Knowledge is the true source of all power. Understand the way the world works to find your destiny in it." Is there anything more obviously beneficial than accelerating your research rate? Out-performing your rivals in technological progress is the most fundamental strategy for victory in any game of Civilization throughout all of its versions. However, there ARE some nuisances you'll have to deal with here and you may find some other leaders with other traits that find ways to compensate this difference can challenge and threaten you regardless of your small scientific edge here. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities produce a couple more base Research. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Research. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists produce an extra Research. [ICON_BULLET]Team Projects are built significantly faster since they often represent major scientific achievements. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are Healthier since knowledge of best health practices is valued higher in this society. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation generates Great People faster since it is seen as a positive thing to be smart. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are focused on Science and Research are faster to build. [ICON_BULLET]Scientist type Specialists generate an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave type Specialists give an additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital produces a percentage more Research. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to developments in Science and Research are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Great Scientists are more likely to be born. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your people suffer more War Weariness as war tends to become a major distraction from scientific funding. [ICON_BULLET]Religious Anarchy time is greatly increased since your people have a hard time adopting new ideas on faith alone. [ICON_BULLET]Non-state religions are even more difficult for your people to tolerate so each adds an unhappiness wherever it is found among your cities. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are slower to train. Your citizens are reluctant to be considered brutish warriors. [ICON_BULLET]All Religions are harder to spread. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer an increased amount of Air Pollution. A lot of experiments involve exotic gasses and chemicals and technology is often based on ways to apply fire. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a little more Educated since knowledge is a social value in your nation.
Scientific II

Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your people suffer more War Weariness as war tends to become a major distraction from scientific funding. Strong Research and Team Project construction. Suffers some Religious and Military penalties and can be challenged with extra Air Pollution.

TEXT.English: Seafaring CT
Seafaring I

Positive Trait "Command the seas and you command the world." The majority of the Earth is covered in water. Waterways are the crossing points where most nations are vulnerable, in transportation of land forces, trade routes and supply lines. When your people consider themselves more at home on the waves than they are on land, we can capitalize on the great power this brings. It also allows us to make the most of the sea's bountiful resources. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Amphibious promotion for Explorers, Melee, Mounted and Throwing unit types so they can ignore naval assault and river crossing penalties. [ICON_BULLET]Free Seafaring I promotion for all Naval units, giving a solid combat modifier and mobility benefit. [ICON_BULLET]Working any Sea Domain plot produces an additional Production. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Naval transport ships all gain an additional cargo space, or a strong volume capacity boost. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Water based improvements that can upgrade do so much faster. [ICON_BULLET]Water based improvements that take time to build will be constructed faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Admiral Specialists gain an additional Food yield. [ICON_BULLET]Great Admiral Specialists gain two additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Sea Domain units gain a few bonus experience points when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Sea Domain units are faster to train. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that give sea travel and warfare benefits are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Great Admirals are birthed faster. [ICON_BULLET]All coastal cities gain an additional trade route if they can reach another coastal city in the trade network. [ICON_BULLET]Many resources derived from naval plots give extra happiness in all your cities. Your people love seafood and are proud of what they bring up from the depths. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Health penalty. Drowning deaths are common. [ICON_BULLET]Overall upkeep is slightly higher since so much focus goes into utilizing the ocean, increasing the costs and investments necessary to do so. [ICON_BULLET]Many land based improvements aren't as valuable. For example, Mines get less Production and Farms get less Food. [ICON_BULLET]Workers lose a quarter of their productivity speed. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. Naval transportation costs to support a nation's infrastructure needs are usually a little higher maintenance and land locked cities are more resentfully supported. [ICON_BULLET]The largest cities in your nation are less happy. Your people are more introverted, being accustomed to the relative isolation experienced on naval voyages.
Seafaring II

Positive Trait "Command the seas and you command the world." The majority of the Earth is covered in water. Waterways are the crossing points where most nations are vulnerable, in transportation of land forces, trade routes and supply lines. When your people consider themselves more at home on the waves than they are on land, we can capitalize on the great power this brings. It also allows us to make the most of the sea's bountiful resources. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Amphibious promotion for Gun and Helicopter unit types so they can ignore naval assault and river crossing penalties. [ICON_BULLET]Free Seafaring II promotion for all Naval units, giving a solid combat modifier and mobility benefit. [ICON_BULLET]Working any Sea Domain plot produces an additional Food. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Naval transport ships all gain an additional cargo space, or a strong volume capacity boost. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Water based improvements that can upgrade do so much faster. [ICON_BULLET]Water based improvements that take time to build will be constructed faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Admiral Specialists gain an additional Production yield. [ICON_BULLET]Great Admiral Specialists gain two additional Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Sea Domain units gain a few bonus experience points when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Sea Domain units are significantly faster to train. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that give sea travel and warfare benefits are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Great Admirals are birthed significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]All coastal cities gain an additional trade route if they can reach another coastal city in the trade network. [ICON_BULLET]Units that can carry missile units gain space for a couple more than normal. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Health penalty. Drowning deaths are common. [ICON_BULLET]Overall upkeep is higher since so much focus goes into utilizing the ocean, increasing the costs and investments necessary to do so. [ICON_BULLET]Many land based improvements aren't as valuable. For example, Mines get less Production and Farms get less Food. [ICON_BULLET]Workers lose a quarter of their productivity speed. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. Naval transportation costs to support a nation's infrastructure needs are usually a little higher maintenance and land locked cities are more resentfully supported.

Dominance over the water terrains in every way possible.
TEXT.French: Domination sur les terrains aquatiques de toutes les manières possibles.
