TEXT.English: Spiritual CT
Spiritual I

Positive Trait "Knowing the nature of self is all important to achieving all things. Seek truth through fully understanding all religions." It has been said that every religion is a different blind man reaching out and feeling different parts of God and their conflicts and disagreements purely stem from having a limited perspective, but all have elements of the truth infused in them, along with misinformation to cover up gaps in the extent of the understanding each possesses. All religions are efforts to explain those things that cannot be proven, things like the meaning of life and its purpose. This leader believes in exploring all deep spiritual thought, seeking deeper truth and benefits to be found in each outlook. To do so, they must completely accept the teachings of each spiritual path to gain the depth of insight each provides. The people agree that being open minded and embracing people of all beliefs is key in solving the greatest mysteries all seek the answers to. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in Religions Anarchy time. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities gain a happiness for each religion maintained in the city, whether it's a state religion or not. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a significant Experience point modifier boost in any Holy City, whether a state religion or not. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Even non-state religions give commerce benefits to cities as if they were the state religion. [ICON_BULLET]A Golden Age begins whenever you birth a Great Prophet. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, Holy Cities and the presence of conflicting religions are less likely to cause problems. [ICON_BULLET]Missionaries are trained significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Food yield. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Research and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Religious and Spiritual technologies are discovered faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Prophets are more likely to be born. [ICON_BULLET]All religions are easier to spread. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Slightly reduced rate of earning Great Military People. The devout of most religions often eschew violence and find it personally paradoxical to make the mastery of warfare their profession. [ICON_BULLET]Combatant units earn one less Experience point when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatant units are slower to train. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates much faster in your nation since so many of your people conscientiously object. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are reduced in length by a quarter, since the society-wide elation of a spiritual breakthrough is more commonplace.
Spiritual II

Positive Trait "Knowing the nature of self is all important to achieving all things. Seek truth through fully understanding all religions." It has been said that every religion is a different blind man reaching out and feeling different parts of God and their conflicts and disagreements purely stem from having a limited perspective, but all have elements of the truth infused in them, along with misinformation to cover up gaps in the extent of the understanding each possesses. All religions are efforts to explain those things that cannot be proven, things like the meaning of life and its purpose. This leader believes in exploring all deep spiritual thought, seeking deeper truth and benefits to be found in each outlook. To do so, they must completely accept the teachings of each spiritual path to gain the depth of insight each provides. The people agree that being open minded and embracing people of all beliefs is key in solving the greatest mysteries all seek the answers to. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Strong reduction in Religions Anarchy time. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities gain a happiness for each religion maintained in the city, whether it's a state religion or not. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a significant Experience point modifier boost in any Holy City, whether a state religion or not. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Gain a free Great Prophet with each new Era you enter. [ICON_BULLET]Gives a cause for all religions to be active when playing on the Religious Disabling option. Even if you HAVE a declared State Religion! With Civics alone, this is only possible when you can't have a State Religion. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, Holy Cities and the presence of conflicting religions are less likely to cause problems. [ICON_BULLET]Missionaries are trained significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Commerce yield. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Religious and Spiritual technologies are discovered faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Prophets are significantly more likely to be born. [ICON_BULLET]All religions are easier to spread. [ICON_BULLET]Access to the Incense Resource gives an extra happiness in all cities in the trade network. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Slightly reduced rate of earning Great Military People. The devout of most religions often eschew violence and find it personally paradoxical to make the mastery of warfare their profession. [ICON_BULLET]Combatant units earn one less Experience point when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatant units are slower to train. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates much faster in your nation since so many of your people conscientiously object. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are significantly reduced in length, since the society-wide elation of a spiritual breakthrough is more commonplace.
Spiritual III

Positive Trait "Knowing the nature of self is all important to achieving all things. Seek truth through fully understanding all religions." All religions are efforts to explain those things that cannot be proven, things like the meaning of life and its purpose. This leader believes in exploring all deep spiritual thought, seeking deeper truth and benefits to be found in each outlook. To do so, they must completely accept the teachings of each spiritual path to gain the depth of insight each provides. The people agree that being open minded and embracing people of all beliefs is key in solving the greatest mysteries all seek the answers to. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a strong Experience point modifier boost in any Holy City, whether a state religion or not. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]No upkeep costs on any of the Religious Civics. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, Holy Cities and the presence of conflicting religions are less likely to cause problems. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a diplomatic bonus since your exposure to so many different points of view has helped you to get into the minds of your rivals and deeply understand their motives. [ICON_BULLET]Great Prophets are much more likely to be born. [ICON_BULLET]All religions are much easier to spread. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Slightly reduced rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are significantly reduced in length, since the society-wide elation of a spiritual breakthrough is more commonplace.

This leader believes in exploring all deep spiritual thought, seeking deeper truth and benefits to be found in each outlook. To do so, they must completely accept the teachings of each spiritual path to gain the depth of insight each provides. The people agree that being open minded and embracing people of all beliefs is key in solving the greatest mysteries all seek the answers to. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]May completely eliminate Religions Anarchy time. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities gain a happiness for each religion maintained in the city, whether it's a state religion or not. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a significant Experience point modifier boost in any Holy City, whether a state religion or not. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Even non-state religions give commerce benefits to cities as if they were the state religion. [ICON_BULLET]A Golden Age begins whenever you birth a Great Prophet. [ICON_BULLET]Gives a cause for all religions to be active when playing on the Religious Disabling option. Even if you HAVE a declared State Religion! With Civics alone, this is only possible when you can't have a State Religion. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, Holy Cities and the presence of conflicting religions are less likely to cause problems. [ICON_BULLET]Missionaries are trained much faster. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Commerce yield. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Gold, Research, Espionage AND Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Religious and Spiritual technologies are discovered faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Prophets are more likely to be born. [ICON_BULLET]All religions are easier to spread. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Reduced rate of earning Great Military People. The devout of most religions often eschew violence and find it personally paradoxical to make the mastery of warfare their profession. [ICON_BULLET]Combatant units earn one less Experience point when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatant units are slower to train. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates much faster in your nation since so many of your people conscientiously object. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are half as long since the society-wide elation of a spiritual breakthrough is more commonplace.
Agile at switching religions and getting the most benefit from collecting as many religions as possible.
TEXT.French: Agile pour changer de religion et tirer le meilleur parti de la collecte du plus de religions possible.
TEXT.Russian: Ëîâêèé â ïåðåêëþ÷åíèè ìåæäó ðåëèãèÿìè è ïîëó÷åíèè ìàêñèìàëüíîé âûãîäû îò ñáîðà êàê ìîæíî áîëüøåãî êîëè÷åñòâà ðåëèãèé.

TEXT.English: Temperamental CT
Temperamental I

Negative Trait "What? You DARE to defy ME? Off with his head! Oh, he's a foreign leader is he? Well then... this means WAR!" Sometimes leaders let the power really get to their heads and they start to act like insolent children, but since they are the ones defining the law and the direction of the nation, they have the authority to do tremendous damage with this abuse. Loyalties can be challenged and morale can suffer but the fear generated by this type of leader can serve them in a few ways. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your units require significantly more experience points to level since they so greatly resent the treatment they suffer. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Production and Commerce. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all less happy under your heavy handed rule. [ICON_BULLET]All cities are penalized by one less base Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness is significantly increased for this nation because your leader comes across as willing to fight without good cause. [ICON_BULLET]Fewer citizens can be drafted during a conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a Diplomatic penalty. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages last a bit shorter in this fearful nation. [ICON_BULLET]Your citizens resent being whipped to rush construction and training longer. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy periods are significantly reduced in fear of your leader's wrath at any delays in establishing policy changes. [ICON_BULLET]It is harder for opponents to perform Espionage missions in your cities for fear of your leader's retribution. [ICON_BULLET]Your enemies suffer from greater War Weariness since the people of rival nations find you frighteningly irrational. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from less crime than usual since punishments are severe.

Diplomatically terrible and lacks for troop loyalty. Less Anarchy time as he has zero tolerance for disagreement. Less Crime because his punishments are severe.
TEXT.French: Diplomatiquement terrible et manque de loyauté envers les troupes. Moins de temps d'anarchie car il n'a aucune tolérance aux désaccords. Moins de criminalité car ses peines sont sévères.

TEXT.English: Covetous CT
Covetous I

Negative Trait "Everything they have is better than what we have. We need to spend our time trying to emulate them so we can have those things too! Trade with them to learn their superior ways!" The jealousy this leader feels impedes his ability to inspire his people to opening up to their own creativity, instead always looking to have the shiny new objects circulating through other nations. He's always disappointed with the accomplishments of his own nation and fails to recognize their achievements, leaving them demoralized in their efforts and feeling like it's just not their role to generate the new things in the world but to collect what others have made instead. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer from a percentage penalty to Research and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer from a percentage penalty to Production and Commerce. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed slower. It is demotivating to think nothing will impress their leader despite their best efforts. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a penalty of a base Research and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a penalty of a base Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]The largest cities in your nation are a little less happy since they live with such strong envy of other metropolitan centers they could never possibly be as impressive as. [ICON_BULLET]Anarchy periods last at least as long as a round, possibly scaled by game speed. Although quick to adopt a solution when it is found, an exhaustive research of the best ways to implement a policy that have been shown by other nations must be undertaken first. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages don't last as long thanks to the underlying feeling of inner disappointment that drags down the mood of the people. [ICON_BULLET]Anger from using slavery to whip rush construction and training lasts longer than normal due to resent by the people for being apparently so poor at getting things done that they must be pushed to such suffering. [ICON_BULLET]Rushing construction and training with gold costs more, as the people are not capable of responding to money motivation in their demoralized state. [ICON_BULLET]Units are a little more expensive to train because you always want to make sure they have the best weaponry, even if it costs you more for ineffective gains. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness is not as strong against your people who see war as an opportunity to take the works of others. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy time is diminished since your bureaucrats are quick to settle on sufficient solutions to policy decisions that are as close to a copy of what others have established elsewhere as possible. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are faster since they keep designs as basic and functional as possible. [ICON_BULLET]All cities get an additional trade route since your merchants are always looking to get what others have. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign Trade Routes are more profitable since your people are always hungry to buy things from foreign lands.

Some trade and diplomatic benefits but loses a lot of strength at home and is weak against espionage.
TEXT.French: Certains avantages commerciaux et diplomatiques, mais perd beaucoup de force à la maison et est faible contre l'espionnage.
TEXT.Russian: Ïîëó÷àåò íåáîëüøóþ âûãîäó â êîììåðöèè è äèïëîìàòèè, íî íà ñîáñòâåííîé òåððèòîðèè âåñüìà ñëàá â âîåííîì ïëàíå è óÿçâèì ïðîòèâ âðàæåñêîãî øïèîíàæà.

TEXT.English: Cowardly CT
TEXT.German: Feige

TEXT.English: Cowardly I
TEXT.German: Feige I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Please don't hurt me!" As afraid as you and your people are of being attacked, the very idea of being assaulted can invigorate them somewhat when they go on the attack. They can be like bullies that are much more confident when they are the aggressor but as soon as they come under fire, they tend to fold. This all stems from their leader having a similar mentality, who panders and blusters to avoid, at all cost, any reproach from anyone. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Assigns the Cowardly I promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large defense penalty but a small attack bonus. [ICON_BULLET]Increased cost of upkeep per unit. Working for the government is perceived as carrying risk of conflict. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Forts upgrade much slower than usual. [ICON_BULLET]Your workers build fort improvements much slower. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants lose some Experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants take longer to train. [ICON_BULLET]Increase in War Weariness your people suffer. There is a cultural sense of terror that grips your people when at war. [ICON_BULLET]Decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Lose some Free Military Units that don't require upkeep as normal that you may be getting from another source. [ICON_BULLET]Units are more likely to be captured when defeated. They are always looking for way they will survive being under attack. Bonuses: [ICON_BULLET]Each military unit you staff in a city makes your citizens feel much safer and thus happier. [ICON_BULLET]Gain an additional Trade route in each city due to the economic amiability of your people so as to appease potential rivals. [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the cost of upgrading units since training can only cover the bare minimums without freaking out your government employees.
TEXT.German: Negative Charaktereigenschaft "Der Feige stirbt schon vielmal, eh' er stirbt, die Tapfern kosten einmal nur den Tod." - William Shakespeare (1564-1616) Feige Anführer leben in ständiger Angst vor Angriffen und versuchen diese auf Biegen und Brechen zu vermeiden. Paradoxerweise führt das dazu, dass ihre Truppen tatsächlich gestärkt sind, solange sie selbst die Angreifer darstellen, in der Verteidigung aber hoffnungslos unterlegen. Sie sind ähnlich wie Raufbolde auf dem Schulhof, die nur solange stark sind, wie sie andere schikanieren können, die aber sofort einknicken, wenn sie selbst in die Schusslinie geraten. Primäre Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte laufende Kosten für militärische Einheiten (Wegen des gefürchteten Konfliktpotenzials wird der Militärdienst nur ungern verrichtet.) Nachteile für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Feige I Weitere Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]gesenkte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Befestigungsanlagen im Umland werden langsamer modernisiert [ICON_BULLET]Arbeitstrupps bauen Befestigungsanlagen langsamer [ICON_BULLET]Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten beim Training weniger Erfahrungspunkte [ICON_BULLET]verzögertes Training für Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten [ICON_BULLET]Steigerung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes (Jeder Kriegszustand versetzt das Volk in Angst und Schrecken.) [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können [ICON_BULLET]weniger freie Einheiten, für die keine laufenden Kosten anfallen [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme eigener Einheiten (Überleben ist alles, was zählt.) Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Zufriedenheit durch stationierte Militäreinheiten in Städten (da die ansässige Bevölkerung sich dadurch sicherer fühlt) [ICON_BULLET]eine Handelsroute mehr pro Stadt (Die Händler sind in der Lage, potenzielle Rivalen zu beschwichtigen.) [ICON_BULLET]Preissenkung für die Modernisierung von Einheiten (Es kann nur am Minimum trainiert werden, da alles andere zu Panik wegen vermeintlicher bevorstehender Konflikte führen würde.)

TEXT.English: Cowardly II
TEXT.German: Feige II

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Please don't hurt me!" As afraid as you and your people are of being attacked, the very idea of being assaulted can invigorate them somewhat when they go on the attack. They can be like bullies that are much more confident when they are the aggressor but as soon as they come under fire, they tend to fold. This all stems from their leader having a similar mentality, who panders and blusters to avoid, at all cost, any reproach from anyone. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Assigns the Cowardly II promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large defense penalty but a small attack bonus. [ICON_BULLET]Increased cost of upkeep per unit. Working for the government is perceived as carrying risk of conflict. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Forts upgrade much slower than usual. [ICON_BULLET]Your workers build fort improvements much slower. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants lose Experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants take longer to train. [ICON_BULLET]Significant increase in War Weariness your people suffer. There is a cultural sense of terror that grips your people when at war. [ICON_BULLET]Significant decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Lose some Free Military Units that don't require upkeep as normal that you may be getting from another source. [ICON_BULLET]Units are much more likely to be captured when defeated. They are always looking for way they will survive being under attack. Bonuses: [ICON_BULLET]Each military unit you staff in a city makes your citizens feel much safer and thus happier. [ICON_BULLET]Gain an additional Trade route in each city due to the economic amiability of your people so as to appease potential rivals. [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the cost of upgrading units since training can only cover the bare minimums without freaking out your government employees. [ICON_BULLET]More likely to capture enemy units when defeating them because their terror driven rage tends to surprise foes into submission and because they can empathize, they are likely to take pity on those who surrender.
TEXT.German: Negative Charaktereigenschaft "Der Feige stirbt schon vielmal, eh' er stirbt, die Tapfern kosten einmal nur den Tod." - William Shakespeare (1564-1616) Feige Anführer leben in ständiger Angst vor Angriffen und versuchen diese auf Biegen und Brechen zu vermeiden. Paradoxerweise führt das dazu, dass ihre Truppen tatsächlich gestärkt sind, solange sie selbst die Angreifer darstellen, in der Verteidigung aber hoffnungslos unterlegen. Sie sind ähnlich wie Raufbolde auf dem Schulhof, die nur solange stark sind, wie sie andere schikanieren können, die aber sofort einknicken, wenn sie selbst in die Schusslinie geraten. Primäre Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte laufende Kosten für militärische Einheiten (Wegen des gefürchteten Konfliktpotenzials wird der Militärdienst nur ungern verrichtet.) Nachteile für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Feige II Weitere Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]gesenkte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Befestigungsanlagen im Umland werden langsamer modernisiert [ICON_BULLET]Arbeitstrupps bauen Befestigungsanlagen langsamer [ICON_BULLET]Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten beim Training weniger Erfahrungspunkte [ICON_BULLET]verzögertes Training für Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten [ICON_BULLET]Steigerung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes (Jeder Kriegszustand versetzt das Volk in Angst und Schrecken.) [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können [ICON_BULLET]weniger freie Einheiten, für die keine laufenden Kosten anfallen [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme eigener Einheiten (Überleben ist alles, was zählt.) Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Zufriedenheit durch stationierte Militäreinheiten in Städten (da die ansässige Bevölkerung sich dadurch sicherer fühlt) [ICON_BULLET]eine Handelsroute mehr pro Stadt (Die Händler sind in der Lage, potenzielle Rivalen zu beschwichtigen.) [ICON_BULLET]Preissenkung für die Modernisierung von Einheiten (Es kann nur am Minimum trainiert werden, da alles andere zu Panik wegen vermeintlicher bevorstehender Konflikte führen würde.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme gegnerischer Einheiten (Die eigenen Truppen lassen aus Angst vor Racheaktionen eher Gnade walten.)

TEXT.English: Cowardly III
TEXT.German: Feige III

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Please don't hurt me!" As afraid as you and your people are of being attacked, the very idea of being assaulted can invigorate them somewhat when they go on the attack. They can be like bullies that are much more confident when they are the aggressor but as soon as they come under fire, they tend to fold. This all stems from their leader having a similar mentality, who panders and blusters to avoid, at all cost, any reproach from anyone. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Assigns the Cowardly III promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large defense penalty but a small attack bonus. [ICON_BULLET]Increased cost of upkeep per unit. Working for the government is perceived as carrying risk of conflict. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Forts upgrade much slower than usual. [ICON_BULLET]Your workers build fort improvements much slower. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants lose Experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants take longer to train. [ICON_BULLET]Strong increase in War Weariness your people suffer. There is a cultural sense of terror that grips your people when at war. [ICON_BULLET]Overwhelming decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Lose some Free Military Units that don't require upkeep as normal that you may be getting from another source. [ICON_BULLET]Units are far more likely to be captured when defeated. They are always looking for way they will survive being under attack. Bonuses: [ICON_BULLET]Each military unit you staff in a city makes your citizens feel much safer and thus happier. [ICON_BULLET]Gain an additional Trade route in each city due to the economic amiability of your people so as to appease potential rivals. [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the cost of upgrading units since training can only cover the bare minimums without freaking out your government employees. [ICON_BULLET]More likely to capture enemy units when defeating them because their terror driven rage tends to surprise foes into submission and because they can empathize, they are likely to take pity on those who surrender.

TEXT.English: Units are very weak when defending but there are some diplomatic benefits.
TEXT.French: Les unités sont très faibles lors de la défense mais il y a des avantages diplomatiques.
TEXT.German: Feige Anführer haben es bei diplomatischen Verhandlungen etwas leichter. Leider sind ihre Truppen sehr schwach in der Verteidigung und neigen dazu, vor Kämpfen davonzulaufen.

TEXT.English: Crooked CT
Crooked I

Negative Trait "A sucker is born every minute and I'm nobody's fool. Those who get ahead are those who take advantage of others." There is an underlying lazy cowardliness in this leader and his people. Although they are quite aggressive at breaking down others when they can stay hidden, operating in the shadows, if attacked, they prove poor at defending themselves, tending to shrink away and flee, finding to their terror that they cannot flee from their homes without being lost forever. They pay heavy economic costs for promoting an every man for himself society. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Crime is significantly increased in your cities. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your Criminal units all gain the Crooked I Promotion, which enhances Crime Spreading and other benefits normally possessed by Criminal units. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less happy since the good people are plagued by these thugs and hoodlums. [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is more expensive thanks to the coffers being commonly pilfered. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are less frequent to emerge since people here are naturally inspired by their Leader to be less disciplined. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a touch less stable on the Revolution option. [ICON_BULLET]Spy Type Specialists are penalized a Commerce each. [ICON_BULLET]Merchant Type Specialists generate one less Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Your Law Enforcement units are trained with a few less Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your Law Enforcement units are trained significantly slower. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers more War Weariness since your Leader and his people are privately very cowardly types. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are less Happy since there is a reduced sense of personal security in the ghettos of the inner cities. [ICON_BULLET]Combat inside your borders produces a bit less Experience thanks to a lack of national pride and loyalty. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are somewhat less defensible since people here are reluctant to help take a stand in the small ways the citizenry often does. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a Diplomatic penalty since other Leaders often understand your Leader is probably only looking for ways to take advantage of them for personal gain. [ICON_BULLET]It is moderately easier to perform Espionage Missions against your cities since information is up for sale by anyone. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities generate an additional base Culture. Creativity is stronger among those who seek ways to get the most they can for the least effort. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that tend to spread Crime, even if overall more beneficial that penalizing, are constructed faster. Overall this is a benefit because it doesn't require you build them, only saves you production expense if you do. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that represent advancements in Criminal thinking are faster to discover. A benefit because you do need these for later prerequisites at least. [ICON_BULLET]Your Criminal units are trained with an additional few Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your Criminal units are trained significantly faster.

They pay heavy economic costs for promoting an every man for himself society. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Crime is significantly increased in your cities. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your Criminal units all gain the Crooked III Promotion, which enhances Crime Spreading and other benefits normally possessed by Criminal units. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less happy since the good people are plagued by these thugs and hoodlums. [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is significantly more expensive thanks to the coffers being commonly pilfered. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are less frequent to emerge since people here are naturally inspired by their Leader to be less disciplined. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a touch less stable on the Revolution option. [ICON_BULLET]Lawyer Type Specialists are penalized a Commerce each. [ICON_BULLET]Investigator Type Specialists generate one less Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Your Law Enforcement units are trained with a few less Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your Law Enforcement units are trained significantly slower. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers far more War Weariness since your Leader and his people are privately very cowardly types. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Corporations are significantly more expensive to maintain due to internal theft. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are less Happy since there is a reduced sense of personal security in the ghettos of the inner cities. [ICON_BULLET]Combat inside your borders produces less Experience thanks to a lack of national pride and loyalty. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less defensible since people here are reluctant to help take a stand in the small ways the citizenry often does. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a Diplomatic penalty since other Leaders often understand your Leader is probably only looking for ways to take advantage of them for personal gain. [ICON_BULLET]It is much easier to perform Espionage Missions against your cities since information is up for sale by anyone. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great People are born more frequently since personal freedom without restraint is highly valued here. [ICON_BULLET]All cities generate an additional base Culture. Creativity is stronger among those who seek ways to get the most they can for the least effort. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that tend to spread Crime, even if overall more beneficial that penalizing, are constructed faster. Overall this is a benefit because it doesn't require you build them, only saves you production expense if you do. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that represent advancements in Criminal thinking are faster to discover. A benefit because you do need these for later prerequisites at least. [ICON_BULLET]Your Criminal units are trained with an additional few Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your Criminal units are trained significantly faster.

TEXT.English: Suffers great crime for some small benefits. Does train more potent criminals.
TEXT.French: Subit un grand crime pour quelques petits avantages. Entraîne des criminels plus puissants.

TEXT.English: Defensive CT
TEXT.German: Defensiv

TEXT.English: Defensive I
TEXT.German: Defensiv I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Victory rarely goes to the aggressor, but rather to the prepared." The best thing you can do with this leader is let your foes attack you and blunt their teeth against your thick hide. Place your forces on strongly defensive ground and they will be impossible to uproot. Capture bottlenecks and hold them to deny your foes passage. Act with impunity, for what are they going to do about it? Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Defensive I promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large defense bonus but a small attack penalty. [ICON_BULLET]Reduced cost of upkeep per military unit. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Forts upgrade much faster than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Your workers build fort improvements faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People Specialists gain an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants gain extra Experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants are trained faster. [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in War Weariness your people suffer. [ICON_BULLET]Small increase to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Gain some Free Military Units that don't require upkeep as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Units are less likely to be captured when defeated. They are staunch forces. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]One less Trade Route in each city due to added security. [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in the amount of War Weariness your enemies suffer since they tend to believe you won't counter-attack. [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the cost of upgrading units since it requires more training to prepare them to master the art of defense. [ICON_BULLET]Less likely to capture enemy units when defeating them since they are not as likely to pursue the defeated.
TEXT.German: Positive Charaktereigenschaft "Wer auf den Krieg vorbereitet ist, kann den Frieden am besten wahren." - George Washington (1732-1799) Ein defensiver Anführer igelt sich am liebsten ein und lässt seine Feinde von seiner starken Verteidigung dezimieren. Wenn er Engpässe besetzen kann, dann gibt es für gegnerische Einheiten nahezu kein Durchkommen mehr. Wer gegen einen defensiven Anführer in den Krieg zieht, der sollte sich auf Materialschlachten einstellen und bereit sein, einen hohen Blutzoll zu entrichten. Primäre Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]reduzierte laufende Kosten für militärische Einheiten Vorteile für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Defensiv I Weitere Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Befestigungsanlagen im Umland werden schneller modernisiert [ICON_BULLET]Arbeitstrupps bauen Befestigungsanlagen schneller [ICON_BULLET]als angesiedelte Spezialisten bringen Große Feldherren zusätzlich [ICON_COMMERCE] [ICON_BULLET]Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten beim Training zusätzliche Erfahrungspunkte [ICON_BULLET]beschleunigtes Training für Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können [ICON_BULLET]zusätzliche freie Einheiten, für die keine laufenden Kosten anfallen [ICON_BULLET]verringerte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme eigener Einheiten Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]eine Handelsroute weniger pro Stadt (durch die erhöhten Sicherheitsvorkehrungen) [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Kriegsmüdigkeit der gegnerischen Bevölkerung (Niemand rechnet mit Gegenangriffen.) [ICON_BULLET]Preisanstieg für die Modernisierung von Einheiten (Ausgefeilte Verteidigungstaktiken zu erlernen, hat seinen Preis.) [ICON_BULLET]verringerte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme gegnerischer Einheiten (Die eigenen Truppen lassen sich nicht auf die Verfolgung Besiegter ein.)

Act with impunity, for what are they going to do about it? Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Defensive promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large defense bonus but a small attack penalty. [ICON_BULLET]Strong reduction in War Weariness your people suffer. There is a cultural sense of confidence that your forces will protect the people. [ICON_BULLET]Reduced cost of upkeep per military unit. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Significant increase in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Forts upgrade twice as fast as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Your workers build fort improvements much faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People Specialists gain an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People Specialists gain two additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants gain extra Experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants are trained faster. [ICON_BULLET]Small increase to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Gain some Free Military Units that don't require upkeep as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Units are much less likely to be captured when defeated. They are staunch forces. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]One less Trade Route in each city due to added security. [ICON_BULLET]Significant reduction in the amount of War Weariness your enemies suffer since they tend to believe you won't counter-attack. [ICON_BULLET]Strong increase in the cost of upgrading units since it requires more training to prepare them to master the art of defense. [ICON_BULLET]Less likely to capture enemy units when defeating them since they are not as likely to pursue the defeated.
TEXT.German: Positive Charaktereigenschaft "Wer auf den Krieg vorbereitet ist, kann den Frieden am besten wahren." - George Washington (1732-1799) Ein defensiver Anführer igelt sich am liebsten ein und lässt seine Feinde von seiner starken Verteidigung dezimieren. Wenn er Engpässe besetzen kann, dann gibt es für gegnerische Einheiten nahezu kein Durchkommen mehr. Wer gegen einen defensiven Anführer in den Krieg zieht, der sollte sich auf Materialschlachten einstellen und bereit sein, einen hohen Blutzoll zu entrichten. Primäre Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes (Das starke Militär sorgt dafür, dass die Bevölkerung sich sicher und beschützt fühlt.) [ICON_BULLET]reduzierte laufende Kosten für militärische Einheiten Vorteile für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Defensiv Weitere Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Befestigungsanlagen im Umland werden schneller modernisiert [ICON_BULLET]Arbeitstrupps bauen Befestigungsanlagen schneller [ICON_BULLET]als angesiedelte Spezialisten bringen Große Feldherren zusätzlich [ICON_COMMERCE] [ICON_BULLET]als angesiedelte Spezialisten bringen Große Feldherren zusätzlich [ICON_RESEARCH] [ICON_BULLET]Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten beim Training zusätzliche Erfahrungspunkte [ICON_BULLET]beschleunigtes Training für Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können [ICON_BULLET]zusätzliche freie Einheiten, für die keine laufenden Kosten anfallen [ICON_BULLET]verringerte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme eigener Einheiten Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]eine Handelsroute weniger pro Stadt (durch die erhöhten Sicherheitsvorkehrungen) [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Kriegsmüdigkeit der gegnerischen Bevölkerung (Niemand rechnet mit Gegenangriffen.) [ICON_BULLET]Preisanstieg für die Modernisierung von Einheiten (Ausgefeilte Verteidigungstaktiken zu erlernen, hat seinen Preis.) [ICON_BULLET]verringerte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme gegnerischer Einheiten (Die eigenen Truppen lassen sich nicht auf die Verfolgung Besiegter ein.)
TEXT.Russian: Positive Trait 'Victory rarely goes to the aggressor, but rather to the prepared.' The best thing you can do with this leader is let your foes attack you and blunt their teeth against your thick hide. Place your forces on strongly defensive ground and they will be impossible to uproot. Capture bottlenecks and hold them to deny your foes passage. Act with impunity, for what are they going to do about it? Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Defensive promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large defense bonus but a small attack penalty. [ICON_BULLET]Strong reduction in War Weariness your people suffer. There is a cultural sense of confidence that your forces will protect the people. [ICON_BULLET]Reduced cost of upkeep per military unit. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Significant increase in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Forts upgrade twice as fast as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Your workers build fort improvements much faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People Specialists gain an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People Specialists gain two additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants gain extra Experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants are trained faster. [ICON_BULLET]Small increase to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Gain some Free Military Units that don't require upkeep as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Units are much less likely to be captured when defeated. They are staunch forces. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]One less Trade Route in each city due to added security. [ICON_BULLET]Significant reduction in the amount of War Weariness your enemies suffer since they tend to believe you won't counter-attack. [ICON_BULLET]Strong increase in the cost of upgrading units since it requires more training to prepare them to master the art of defense. [ICON_BULLET]Less likely to capture enemy units when defeating them since they are not as likely to pursue the defeated.

TEXT.English: Military focused with a 'Hold your ground' ideal.
TEXT.French: Militaire concentré avec un idéal «Tenez votre terrain».
TEXT.German: Defensive Anführer haben kein großes Interesse an Angriffskriegen, sie nutzen ihr Militär hauptsächlich zur Sicherung ihrer eigenen Landesgrenzen.
TEXT.Russian: Âîåííûå ñôîêóñèðîâàíû íà ïðèíöèïå: «Íè ïÿäè ðîäíîé çåìëè âðàãó íå îòäàäèì!»

TEXT.English: Dynamic CT
Dynamic I

Positive Trait "I push my nation to operate as quickly as it can, for there is much work to be done. We will take the initiative and beat all others to the goals only one may ever obtain. I have many plans and goals and all of them build onto one another, are interconnected. So many working parts and I keep them all spinning. I WILL leave a legacy!" The goal of this leader is for he and his people to leave behind as incredible a legacy as possible in the amount of time he has to achieve it. He pushes his people hard to find great accomplishments but cuts some corners on some things to achieve this, like trade investments. Any buildings and techs that increase productivity are faster to come together as they get higher priority resources. Units are trained with a little less quality. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders, National Wonders, and Team Projects are constructed significantly faster than usual. [ICON_BULLET]Rushing construction and training costs much less than normal. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that speed up construction and training are constructed faster. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that give benefits for being first to research them are discovered faster. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy periods don't last as long because your Leader more rapidly addresses the problems with new policy shifts. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements naturally upgrade twice as fast. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are much faster than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Your people are more efficient at their jobs and thus you gain a Free Specialist in all cities to represent that added amount of labor. [ICON_BULLET]Military Units are faster to train due to streamlined training regimens. [ICON_BULLET]The people are faster to forgive whipping to rush construction and training. [ICON_BULLET]Units are cheaper to upgrade since they are faster to learn new ways to fight. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Trade Route profits are reduced for Food yields. [ICON_BULLET]Units begin with one less Experience Point due to streamlined training procedures. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation naturally supports a reduced amount of Free Units based on a small percentage of the overall total population. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages don't last as long because people get back to a sense of normal faster.

TEXT.English: Production bonuses and efficiency benefits but can lack for quality and can lead to long term unnecessary expenses due to accounting errors in the system. Runs out of patience even with positive things. Fast wonder builder.
TEXT.French: Des primes de production et des gains d'efficacité mais peuvent manquer de qualité et entraîner des dépenses inutiles à long terme en raison d'erreurs comptables dans le système. Manque de patience même avec des choses positives. Constructeur de merveilles rapide.

TEXT.English: Efficient CT
Efficient I

Positive Trait "Make the most of what your nation provides you as a government. Cut corners in budget expenses so you have more to reinvest into high yield returns." This leader runs the government like a very successful business that's not looking to profit so much as find out just how strong they can get the economy running overall. War is considered a little messy and undesirable for perfect function usually. Economic regulations are constantly perfected to a higher degree than most governments, making shifts in large scale policies more difficult to endure. Crime is a little higher here because there is the temptation of so much wealth to tap into and the economic competitiveness spurs more white-collar abuses. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]An additional Commerce is generated by any plot that generates as much as 7 or more. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain an additional base Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Commerce. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All trade routes gain a percentage improvement to Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements generate an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements upgrade much faster than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements are much faster for your workers to build. [ICON_BULLET]Lawyer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Gains an additional maximum Trade Route Cap in each city. [ICON_BULLET]Great Statesmen are more likely to be born. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates faster for your people, as war is a nuisance to commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Anarchy time from switching civics is much longer. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers more Crime.

TEXT.English: Efficient II

Positive Trait "Make the most of what your nation provides you as a government. Cut corners in budget expenses so you have more to reinvest into high yield returns." This leader runs the government like a very successful business that's not looking to profit so much as find out just how strong they can get the economy running overall. War is considered a little messy and undesirable for perfect function usually. Economic regulations are constantly perfected to a higher degree than most governments, making shifts in large scale policies more difficult to endure. Crime is a little higher here because there is the temptation of so much wealth to tap into and the economic competitiveness spurs more white-collar abuses. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]The threshold for a plot generating an additional Commerce drops from 7 to 6. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain additional base Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Commerce. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All trade routes gain a percentage improvement to Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements generate an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements upgrade much faster than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce focused improvements are much faster for your workers to build. [ICON_BULLET]Lawyer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Corporation upkeep gets a significant reduction. [ICON_BULLET]Gains an additional maximum Trade Route Cap in each city. [ICON_BULLET]Great Statesmen are significantly more likely to be born. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates faster for your people, as war is a nuisance to commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Anarchy time from switching civics is much longer. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers more Crime.

TEXT.English: Strong Commerce income. A little extra anarchy time from the added struggle of having to reallocate investments to suit the new legal structure.
TEXT.French: Fort revenu du commerce. Un peu de temps d'anarchie supplémentaire de la lutte supplémentaire d'avoir à réaffecter des investissements en fonction de la nouvelle structure juridique.

TEXT.English: Gloomy CT
Gloomy I

Negative Trait "Faith will not help us. It's just us against the world so we must stay very serious about this struggle and never give in to fantasy or imagined glory." This dour downer tends to depress his nation but at least his people know he's taking things seriously. Pride is considered a dangerous thing to maintain here so morale can suffer in a number of ways and religion is not as valued, and for many is deeply resented, as it cannot be empirically proven so appears tremendously foolish to a good portion of the populace, who have adopted the views of their leader. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Yield benefits from being in a Golden Age are significantly decreased. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce benefits from being in a Golden Age are significantly decreased. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages last far fewer rounds. [ICON_BULLET]Lose a percentage Experience point modifier boost in the Holy City of your state religion. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed slower in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are constructed significantly slower in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, Holy Cities of your state religion are less stable. [ICON_BULLET]Religious Buildings are slower to build. [ICON_BULLET]Cities where your State Religion is present are significantly slower at producing Great People, for it is often merely used to convince an even greater sense of the importance of toil. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you've spread your State Religion, your people are assigned a base unhappiness due to the conflict it creates in private lives. [ICON_BULLET]Units take longer to build where the state religion has spread. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings take longer to construct where the state religion has spread. [ICON_BULLET]Using slavery to rush builds results in greater lengths of city unhappiness as people resent being asked to push even harder than they already must. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, Holy Cities of non-state religions are more stable. [ICON_BULLET]The value of labor is high here so you get a Free Specialist in each city. [ICON_BULLET]Your people gain an Education bonus since nothing is glossed over for the sake of protecting innocence.

TEXT.English: Golden Ages are much less valuable for this leader and his people, and there are some secondary impediments to religion.
TEXT.French: Les âges d'or sont beaucoup moins précieux pour ce chef et son peuple, et il existe des obstacles secondaires à la religion.
TEXT.Russian: Çîëîòîé âåê ãîðàçäî ìåíåå öåíåí äëÿ ýòîãî ëèäåðà è åãî íàðîäà, è åñòü íåêîòîðûå âòîðîñòåïåííûå ïðåïÿòñòâèÿ äëÿ ðàñïðîñòðàíåíèÿ ðåëèãèé.

TEXT.English: Glorious CT
Glorious I

Positive Trait "Our leader stands at the side of the Divine. Divine forces are aligned with us, as we are the chosen people." Your leader may or may not believe in what he claims but he surely understands the power of pumping the morale of the people with the idea of exceptionalism. Your people have been well convinced that they are special and blessed and while that might be insufferable to some, you can't deny that there is almost always a great sense of pride for being a citizen here. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Yield benefits from being in a Golden Age are increased significantly. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce benefits from being in a Golden Age are increased significantly. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages last half again as long as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a percentage Experience point modifier boost in the Holy City of your state religion. [ICON_BULLET]All cities you found or capture are immediately given your state religion. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed faster in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are constructed faster in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, Holy Cities of your state religion are more stable. [ICON_BULLET]Religious Buildings are faster to build. [ICON_BULLET]Cities where your State Religion is present are significantly faster at producing Great People. [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in the length of unhappiness from using slavery to rush builds. People are more willing to put in the sacrifice. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, Holy Cities of non-state religions are less stable. [ICON_BULLET]The narcissism you've spread among your people has a labor demotivating effect, so you lose a Free Specialist. [ICON_BULLET]Your people suffer an Education penalty, since your leader often misleads them into false claims to support the premise of their superiority.
TEXT.Russian: Positive Trait 'Our leader stands at the side of the Divine. Divine forces are aligned with us, as we are the chosen people.' Your leader may or may not believe in what he claims but he surely understands the power of pumping the morale of the people with the idea of exceptionalism. Your people have been well convinced that they are special and blessed and while that might be insufferable to some, you can't deny that there is almost always a great sense of pride for being a citizen here. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Yield benefits from being in a Golden Age are increased significantly. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce benefits from being in a Golden Age are increased significantly. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages last half again as long as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a percentage Experience point modifier boost in the Holy City of your state religion. [ICON_BULLET]All cities you found or capture are immediately given your state religion. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed faster in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are constructed faster in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, Holy Cities of your state religion are more stable. [ICON_BULLET]Religious Buildings are faster to build. [ICON_BULLET]Cities where your State Religion is present are significantly faster at producing Great People. [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in the length of unhappiness from using slavery to rush builds. People are more willing to put in the sacrifice. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, Holy Cities of non-state religions are less stable. [ICON_BULLET]The narcissism you've spread among your people has a labor demotivating effect, so you lose a Free Specialist. [ICON_BULLET]Your people suffer an Education penalty, since your leader often misleads them into false claims to support the premise of their superiority.

TEXT.English: Glorious II

Positive Trait "Our leader stands at the side of the Divine. Divine forces are aligned with us, as we are the chosen people." Your leader may or may not believe in what he claims but he surely understands the power of pumping the morale of the people with the idea of exceptionalism. Your people have been well convinced that they are special and blessed and while that might be insufferable to some, you can't deny that there is almost always a great sense of pride for being a citizen here. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Yield benefits from being in a Golden Age are increased significantly. [ICON_BULLET]Commerce benefits from being in a Golden Age are increased significantly. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages last half again as long as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a percentage Experience point modifier boost in the Holy City of your state religion. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed faster in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are constructed faster in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, Holy Cities of your state religion are more stable. [ICON_BULLET]Religious Buildings are faster to build. [ICON_BULLET]Cities where your State Religion is present are significantly faster at producing Great People. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you've spread your State Religion, your people are happier. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, Holy Cities of non-state religions are less stable. [ICON_BULLET]Religious Anarchy periods much longer since the people are so proud of being central to the religion they believe. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer an increase in the Maintenance from Number of Cities since spending on regular revelry creates significant expenses for each urban center. [ICON_BULLET]The narcissism you've spread among your people has a labor demotivating effect, so you lose a Free Specialist. [ICON_BULLET]Your people suffer an Education penalty, since your leader often misleads them into false claims to support the premise of their superiority.

TEXT.English: Golden Age enhancement with secondary religious elements.

TEXT.Russian: Ïðîäëåíèå Çîëîòîãî Âåêà ïðè ïîìîùè âòîðè÷íûõ ðåëèãèîçíûõ ýëåìåíòîâ.

TEXT.English: Gluttonous CT
Gluttonous I

Negative Trait "Eat what we have while we have it for famine may strike any day." Though you and your people may be unhealthy from being overweight and underworked, they tend to be blissful, particularly in urban lifestyles where they can be truly excessive with the nation's bounty. Primary Penalty: [ICON_BULLET]One less Food is generated by any plot that generates as much as 7 or more. [ICON_BULLET]All cities lose one base Food. [ICON_BULLET]All cities lose a percentage penalty to Food. Unique Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]Food is converted to Production in any unit engaged in training a unit. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all less healthy thanks to eating in excess. [ICON_BULLET]Food focused improvements generate less Food. [ICON_BULLET]Food focused improvements upgrade much slower as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Food focused improvements are much slower for your workers to build. [ICON_BULLET]Noble, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists are penalized a Food. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that enhance food production and storage are discovered slower. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance for Number of Cities is increased since communities often eat more than they are budgeted for. [ICON_BULLET]Military units take longer to train since they are often more overweight when they enlist and require more training to get in shape. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all happier. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are faster to be born because your people feel more comfortable being themselves. [ICON_BULLET]Satiated citizens are less argumentative, so Civic changes don't cause as much Anarchy time.

TEXT.English: Gluttonous II

Negative Trait "Eat what we have while we have it for famine may strike any day." Though you and your people may be unhealthy from being overweight and underworked, they tend to be blissful, particularly in urban lifestyles where they can be truly excessive with the nation's bounty. Primary Penalty: [ICON_BULLET]The threshold for a plot generating one less food drops from 7 to 6. [ICON_BULLET]All cities lose some base Food. [ICON_BULLET]All cities lose a percentage penalty to Food. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all significantly less healthy thanks to eating in excess. [ICON_BULLET]Food focused improvements generate less Food. [ICON_BULLET]Food focused improvements upgrade much slower as normal. [ICON_BULLET]Food focused improvements are much slower for your workers to build. [ICON_BULLET]Noble, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists are penalized a Food. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that enhance food production and storage are discovered slower. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance for Number of Cities is increased since communities often eat more than they are budgeted for. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all happier. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are faster to be born because your people feel more comfortable being themselves. [ICON_BULLET]Satiated citizens are less argumentative, so Civic changes don't cause as much Anarchy time. [ICON_BULLET]Corporation upkeep is diminished due to higher profits from food product sales. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are happier since your people prefer urban living. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages last longer than usual because your people greatly enjoy times of prosperity.

TEXT.English: Poor food, mostly due to extra consumption. Happier people thinking things are always plentiful when in reality they often deplete their food stores.
TEXT.French: Mauvaise nourriture, principalement en raison d'une consommation supplémentaire. Les gens plus heureux qui pensent que les choses sont toujours abondantes alors qu'en réalité, ils épuisent souvent leurs magasins d'alimentation.
TEXT.Russian: Ñêóäíîñòü ñ ïðîäîâîëüñòâèåì, â îñíîâíîì èç-çà ÷ðåçìåðíîãî ïîòðåáëåíèÿ. Áîëåå ñ÷àñòëèâûå ëþäè, äóìàþùèå, ÷òî èõ îêðóæàåò èçîáèëèå, òîãäà êàê â äåéñòâèòåëüíîñòè îíè ÷àñòî èñòîùàþò ñâîè çàïàñû ïðîäîâîëüñòâèÿ.

TEXT.English: Greedy CT
Greedy I

Negative Trait "The wealth of the nation is my own to hoard and spend on my own desires." A lot of the treasury goes missing here thanks to you and others dipping into profits for personal goals. People are unhappy with all the selfish financial corruption at the top. Some spending selfish to the leader is beneficial and he's quick to exploit people so in some cases that can benefit the national interest. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities produce a couple less base Gold. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Gold. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists cost a Gold. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all less happy, knowing of your excesses with their taxed earnings. [ICON_BULLET]The overall upkeep expense is higher due to skimming. [ICON_BULLET]Fewer Great People are born here because financial opportunity is more scarce. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are focused on wealth generation are slower to build. [ICON_BULLET]Merchant type Specialists are penalized a Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave type Specialists cost a Gold penalty. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital generates a small percentage less Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to wealth improvements are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Corporate Maintenance is increased. Corporations suffer from higher taxation and thus do not run as efficiently. [ICON_BULLET]Great Merchants are less likely to be born. [ICON_BULLET]Public financial desperation increases the Crime rate. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed faster due to increased spending on anything the leader wants. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are constructed faster since local governing bodies are happy to overspend to match the leader's budgets for impressive works. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy time is slightly reduced since palms are quickly greased to adapt to the leader's whims. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements upgrade faster naturally since the leader is happy to spend to excess to make this happen. [ICON_BULLET]Workers complete improvements on plots faster since the crews are overfunded. [ICON_BULLET]An extra citizens can be drafted with a conscription action because more people are desperate to find ways to support their families. [ICON_BULLET]Underpaying the salaries for your military gives you some extra free units. [ICON_BULLET]The cost of rushing buildings and units is reduced significantly as people are willing to work for less where money is scarce.

TEXT.English: Grim CT
Grim I

Negative Trait "This is a harsh world. Raising children in this environment is a major risk to the community even if it is necessary to our future. Aside from it being quite possible to end up with too many mouths to feed, we can also quickly end up with too many voices to contend with. I urge restraint so that we may provide for those in our care while retaining as much focus on more important matters as we can. It is THIS generation that is my concern, much moreso than the next." This Leader is worried that if his people overgrow their infrastructure to support them that he will be faced with starvation and be saddled with added expenses to the nation's coffers. He therefore promotes smaller families that wait to grow until they are financially secure and well prepared to support their kids. It may not be unwise, but it does impede population expansion and ultimately the strength of the nation. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Cities require a little more food to grow. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities are less happy with this dour outlook. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are born slower here due to the expressed lack of confidence in people to provide and excel. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all produce one less base Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates faster since your people invest more into their young and feel they have less people to sacrifice to a war. [ICON_BULLET]You get fewer citizens drafted with each conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to City is enhanced due to greater investments into more vulnerable regions. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is increased since your Leader tends to overspend to insure additional communities against fears for their well-being. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are trained somewhat slower since there is a reluctance among families to allow their children to enlist. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages don't last as long thanks to the more serious outlook people take here tending to dampen spirits. [ICON_BULLET]Anger for rushing construction and training lasts longer here since life is held at a high value. [ICON_BULLET]Units you defeat are somewhat less likely to be captured because of concerns of bringing potential enemies home. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are more likely to be captured when defeated because they have been taught to value self preservation. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great Generals emerge a little faster since it is of the utmost importance that militaries from smaller populations are led more effectively. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities generate an extra base Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all gain a percentage modifier to Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave type Specialists work harder to produce for their employers since there are fewer of them to go around, so earn an extra Gold each. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities have slightly improved defenses thanks to your added investments into their safety.

[ICON_BULLET]Great People are born slower here due to the expressed lack of confidence in people to provide and excel. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all produce one less base Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates faster since your people invest more into their young and feel they have less people to sacrifice to a war. [ICON_BULLET]You get fewer citizens drafted with each conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to City is enhanced due to greater investments into more vulnerable regions. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is increased since your Leader tends to overspend to insure additional communities against fears for their well-being. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are less happy because you show more worry for your most populous centers. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are trained moderately slower since there is a reluctance among families to allow their children to enlist. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages don't last as long thanks to the more serious outlook people take here tending to dampen spirits. [ICON_BULLET]Anger for rushing construction and training lasts longer here since life is held at a high value. [ICON_BULLET]Units you defeat are somewhat less likely to be captured because of concerns of bringing potential enemies home. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are significantly more likely to be captured when defeated because they have been taught to value self preservation. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great Generals emerge faster since it is of the utmost importance that militaries from smaller populations are led more effectively. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities generate an extra base Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all gain a percentage modifier to Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Noble and Law type Specialists promote policies that help families earn more thus produce an extra Gold each. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities have improved defenses thanks to your added investments into their safety.

I urge restraint so that we may provide for those in our care while retaining as much focus on more important matters as we can. It is THIS generation that is my concern, much moreso than the next.' TEXT.English: Honest CT
Honest I

Positive Trait "One is judged by the integrity of their word. The state needs to be upfront and share our knowledge with the people." Some may question whether an honest, forthright, straightforward Leader is a wise one. But this Leader knows how to use his honesty in a manner that serves him, proverbially throwing himself on his sword when necessary to prove the point that he will always be open with people, even when it would be more convenient not to be. He's not all that great with Espionage, rather his people aren't thanks to not being quite as clever as their Leader when adopting him as a role-model. He is well loved by all and his policy of truth pays off with many dividends in trade and diplomacy, most powerfully to strongly motivate his people when he can clearly show that the nation is on the right track. He is no fool and is not hobbled strategically by his nature. He may be honest, but he also knows how to time the release of information in the most effective manner possible. More often, his tactic to achieve this strategy is to avoid having things to hide in the first place. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your people are significantly easier to Educate. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are significantly more profitable for all Yields. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are significantly more profitable for all Commerces. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all happier, able to believe their Leader. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy periods are reduced. [ICON_BULLET]All of your cities gain an additional trade route. Merchants love the straightforward deals they get here. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic bonus since other Leaders feel they can take you at your word. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign Trade Routes are more profitable since your people's fair dealings lead to improved results with foreign businessmen who are normally reluctant to trust. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are significantly easier to perform Espionage Missions in. [ICON_BULLET]The length of Golden Ages is significantly reduced since your society takes so much advantage of the time they have in their exuberance. [ICON_BULLET]Your people take significantly longer to forgive being whipped to rush construction and training projects. [ICON_BULLET]All non-state religions are significantly harder to spread.

TEXT.English: Education benefits. Political and trade benefits. Nation is much more powerful during Golden Ages, though those are a bit shorter. Popular. Can suffer with some Espionage penalties.
TEXT.French: Avantages d'éducation. Avantages politiques et commerciaux. Nation est beaucoup plus puissant pendant l'âge d'or, bien que ceux-ci soient un peu plus courts. Populaire. Peut souffrir avec quelques pénalités d'espionnage.

TEXT.English: Humble CT
Humble I

Positive Trait "All ideas should be heard and respected. I judge all things down the middle of any disagreement to make the best determinations." This leader enjoys a nation that is very productive in gold, espionage, food and production. His people don't seek glory, which is as helpful with diplomacy. In fact, this is one of the most beneficial traits for working with other leaders. However, on the downside, impressive works and the personal achievements that make individuals great are not all that important to this society and are therefore harder to generate. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Gold and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Food and Production. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Overall upkeep is reduced a little since there is improved cooperative efforts among governmental factions with competing needs. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders and Team Projects are faster to build due to the degree of cohesive cooperation and willingness to enhance local support functions that your citizens display. [ICON_BULLET]All cities get an additional base Gold and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities get an additional base Food and Production. [ICON_BULLET]Gains a bonus to Diplomacy. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a little harder to perform espionage missions against since your people are naturally reserved and don't brag openly about what they are involved in. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer a little less from Crime since egotism drives a lot of criminal behavior and that isn't as problematic here. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Great People are a little slower to be born since achieving greatness is not highly important to people who see their leader as a role model. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People don't emerge quite as fast since competitive dominance is not a supported value here. [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders take longer to build because the nation doesn't feel it has anything to prove. [ICON_BULLET]Anarchy time when changing Civics is significantly longer since all voices in the policy discussion are heard and decisions aren't made until solutions all sides can settle on are found. [ICON_BULLET]Military units take longer to train since the warrior's natural competitiveness is a rare personality to find here. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are more easily captured when defeated because they don't see surrender as a strike against their pride.

TEXT.English: Generically good in almost all areas of governing. Investment strategies and warnings are followed (+Gold) and Intelligence Advisors are often sought for advice (+Espionage). However, lacks for some aggression and in times of great disagreements can greatly struggle to find a good solution to make all sides happy.
TEXT.French: Généralement bon dans presque tous les domaines de la gouvernance. Les stratégies d'investissement et les avertissements sont suivis (+ or) et les conseillers en renseignement sont souvent recherchés pour des conseils (+ espionnage). Cependant, il manque une certaine agressivité et en période de grands désaccords, il peut être très difficile de trouver une bonne solution pour rendre toutes les parties heureuses.

TEXT.English: Impulsive CT
Impulsive I

Negative Trait "The time taken to plan carefully is the time in which you lose the initiative. Act now or lose out! Sure it leads to lots of mistakes but its better than sitting still!" Gains a highly lubricated government. Low upkeep and faster results. Leader and his followers are not as mentally agile so since war is chaotic it is irritating to the habit driven people, and it takes longer to reorganize the government properly after a change in policies. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Overall Upkeep is increased tremendously. [ICON_BULLET]All specialists lose a Production. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is tremendously increased. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is hugely increased. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Improvements naturally upgrade far slower since your people demand work crews come and get them upgraded immediately whenever an upgrade is available. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are much slower since they tend to start projects without plans and make a lot of time costly mistakes. [ICON_BULLET]Your units start with one less Experience point since your leader is impatient to get them out of training. [ICON_BULLET]You lose a number of Free Units if you were getting any. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a penalty to the number of Free Units you get based on a small percentage of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are less happy thanks to sloppy urban planning making life harder on folks. [ICON_BULLET]Military Units are slower to train because training curricula are whatever the trainers feel like that day. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]It takes a bit less experience for your units to level and thus gain promotions. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are slightly faster to emerge since your people find it natural to jump into leadership roles. [ICON_BULLET]Artist and Slave type Specialists are more freely creative and thus give an additional Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy time is shorter since your Leader is impatient to implement new policies.

[ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are faster to emerge since your people find it natural to jump into leadership roles. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy time is significantly shorter since your Leader is impatient to implement new policies.
