[ICON_BULLET]Improvements naturally upgrade far slower since your people demand work crews come and get them upgraded immediately whenever an upgrade is available. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are much slower since they tend to start projects without plans and make a lot of time costly mistakes. [ICON_BULLET]Corporations require significantly more upkeep. [ICON_BULLET]Your units start with one less Experience point since your leader is impatient to get them out of training. [ICON_BULLET]You lose a number of Free Units if you were getting any. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a penalty to the number of Free Units you get based on a percentage of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are much less happy thanks to sloppy urban planning making life harder on folks. [ICON_BULLET]Military Units are slower to train because training curricula are whatever the trainers feel like that day. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]It takes a bit less experience for your units to level and thus gain promotions. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are moderately faster to emerge since your people find it natural to jump into leadership roles. [ICON_BULLET]Law and Investigator type Specialists are faster to protect expressive rights and thus create a Culture each. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy time is significantly shorter since your Leader is impatient to implement new policies.

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "The time taken to plan carefully is the time in which you lose the initiative. Act now or lose out! Sure it leads to lots of mistakes but its better than sitting still!" Gains a highly lubricated government. Low upkeep and faster results. Leader and his followers are not as mentally agile so since war is chaotic it is irritating to the habit driven people, and it takes longer to reorganize the government properly after a change in policies. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Overall Upkeep is increased tremendously. [ICON_BULLET]All specialists lose a Production. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is tremendously increased. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is hugely increased. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Improvements naturally upgrade far slower since your people demand work crews come and get them upgraded immediately whenever an upgrade is available. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are much slower since they tend to start projects without plans and make a lot of time costly mistakes. [ICON_BULLET]Corporations require significantly more upkeep. [ICON_BULLET]Your units start with one less Experience point since your leader is impatient to get them out of training. [ICON_BULLET]You lose a number of Free Units if you were getting any. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a penalty to the number of Free Units you get based on a moderate percentage of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are less happy thanks to sloppy urban planning making life harder on folks. [ICON_BULLET]Military Units are slower to train because training curricula are whatever the trainers feel like that day. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]It takes a bit less experience for your units to level and thus gain promotions. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are faster to emerge since your people find it natural to jump into leadership roles. [ICON_BULLET]Celebrity and Noble type Specialists are more freely creative and thus give an additional Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy time is much shorter since your Leader is impatient to implement new policies. [ICON_BULLET]It costs significantly less to rush construction and training because it's totally normal to expedite things with a greater investment.

TEXT.English: You suffer from a lot more upkeep and your people aren't as productive and suffer from a lack of organization. However, your military isn't as scared to specialize in whatever seems needed at the time.
TEXT.French: Vous souffrez de beaucoup plus d'entretien et vos employés ne sont pas aussi productifs et souffrent d'un manque d'organisation. Cependant, vos militaires n'ont pas aussi peur de se spécialiser dans ce qui semble nécessaire à l'époque.
TEXT.Russian: Ôèíàíñû ñòðàíû ñòðàäàþò îò ãîðàçäî áîëüøèõ ðàñõîäîâ, à âàøè ëþäè íå òàê ïðîäóêòèâíû è ñòðàäàþò îò íåäîñòàòêà îðãàíèçàöèè. Òåì íå ìåíåå, âàøè âîåííûå íå òàê ðåãëàìåíòèðîâàíû, ÷òîáû ñïåöèàëèçèðîâàòüñÿ íà òîì, ÷òî êàæåòñÿ íåîáõîäèìûì â òî âðåìÿ.

TEXT.English: Lawful CT
Lawful I

Positive Trait "No society is fit to function until all of its people can learn to follow the laws as established. Enforcing them is of the utmost importance." Ruling his nation with an Iron Fist, this leader is not as concerned with whether the law is liberating or oppressive so much as that it is followed. He spends the resources needed on rooting out corruption, wherever it may exist. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Each Military unit you staff in a city adds more happiness. It's a comfort to know that if you can't get away with anything here, nobody else will either. [ICON_BULLET]Crime is significantly reduced in your cities. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your Law Enforcement units all gain the Lawful I Promotion, which enhances Crime Control and other benefits possessed by Law Enforcement units. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Battles inside your borders produce Great Military People faster due to the increased discipline required here. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a touch more stable on the Revolution option. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings involving Crime Fighting are constructed faster. [ICON_BULLET]Spy Type Specialists gain a Commerce each. [ICON_BULLET]Merchant Type Specialists gain an additional Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that represent advancements in Law Enforcement methods are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your Law Enforcement units are trained with an additional few Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your Law Enforcement units are trained significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers less War Weariness since the public is less likely to offer resistance. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are Happier since there is less fear of hidden threats in the crowd. [ICON_BULLET]Combat inside your borders produces slightly more Experience thanks to heightened discipline within your lands. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are built to control everything, so are slightly easier to defend. [ICON_BULLET]It is moderately harder to perform Espionage Missions against your cities thanks to a high degree of authoritative monitoring. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less happy living under the rule of this total square who allows no naughty fun to be had. [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is higher since budget is poured into Law Enforcement without restraint. [ICON_BULLET]All cities are penalized a base Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Access to Cannabis, Opium, Peyote, LSD, Meth or Ecstasy creates an unhappiness each as it really freaks people out to be exposed to the great personal risk involved in being associated with these substances.

TEXT.English: No society is fit to function until all of its people can learn to follow the laws as established. Enforcing them is of the utmost importance.
TEXT.French: Aucune société n'est apte à fonctionner tant que tous ses habitants ne peuvent pas apprendre à suivre les lois établies. Leur application est de la plus haute importance.
TEXT.Russian: Íè îäíî îáùåñòâî íå ìîæåò ôóíêöèîíèðîâàòü, ïîêà âñå åãî ëþäè íå íàó÷àòñÿ ñëåäîâàòü óñòàíîâëåííûì çàêîíàì. Îáåñïå÷åíèå èõ ñîáëþäåíèÿ èìååò ïåðâîñòåïåííîå çíà÷åíèå.

TEXT.English: Lazy CT
Lazy I

Negative Trait "Relax and enjoy life before its all gone! Too much work is just a big buzz kill." If you believe you can be successful with a lot less overall production, you may find this to be a softly penalizing negative trait, particularly if you aren't going to rely on Engineers, Citizens, and Slave specialist assignments much. Other traits may well be able to compensate the reduced core production while you benefit from some stronger health and happiness and hardly having any concerns with Pollution. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]One less Production is generated by any plot that generates as much as 7 or more. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer one less base Production. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Production. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Production focused improvements generate less Production. [ICON_BULLET]Production focused improvements upgrade far slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Production focused improvements are much slower for your workers to build. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate less Production. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that bring improvements to industry are slower to research. [ICON_BULLET]Your workers are slower at building improvements overall. [ICON_BULLET]Great Engineers are less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]More Health in each city since there are less injuries with a lighter workload. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate one more Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers somewhat less Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers somewhat less Water Pollution.
TEXT.Russian: Negative Trait 'Relax and enjoy life before its all gone! Too much work is just a big buzz kill.' If you believe you can be successful with a lot less overall production, you may find this to be a softly penalizing negative trait, particularly if you aren't going to rely on Engineers, Citizens, and Slave specialist assignments much. Other traits may well be able to compensate the reduced core production while you benefit from some stronger health and happiness and hardly having any concerns with Pollution. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]One less Production is generated by any plot that generates as much as 7 or more. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer one less base Production. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Production. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Production focused improvements generate less Production. [ICON_BULLET]Production focused improvements upgrade far slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Production focused improvements are much slower for your workers to build. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate less Production. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that bring improvements to industry are slower to research. [ICON_BULLET]Your workers are slower at building improvements overall. [ICON_BULLET]Great Engineers are less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]More Health in each city since there are less injuries with a lighter workload. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate one more Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers somewhat less Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers somewhat less Water Pollution.

TEXT.English: Lazy II

Negative Trait "Relax and enjoy life before its all gone! Too much work is just a big buzz kill." If you believe you can be successful with a lot less overall production, you may find this to be a softly penalizing negative trait, particularly if you aren't going to rely on Engineers, Citizens, and Slave specialist assignments much. Other traits may well be able to compensate the reduced core production while you benefit from some stronger health and happiness and hardly having any concerns with Pollution. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]The threshold for a plot generating one less production drops from 7 to 6. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer less base Production. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Production. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Production focused improvements generate less Production. [ICON_BULLET]Production focused improvements upgrade far slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Production focused improvements are much slower for your workers to build. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate less Production. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that bring improvements to industry are slower to research. [ICON_BULLET]Your workers are slower at building improvements overall. [ICON_BULLET]Great Engineers are significantly less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]More Happiness since people spend more time in play than laboring. [ICON_BULLET]Engineer, Citizen, and Slave type Specialists generate one more Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers a bit less Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Suffers a bit less Water Pollution.

TEXT.French: Mauvaise production mais en tire un peu de bonheur.

TEXT.English: Liar CT
Liar I

Negative Trait "What they don't know won't hurt you." Your Leader really doesn't care if people trust him or not. If he has something to hide, he'll do his best to hide it. Unfortunately, he's not all that good at it and frequently gets caught lying and bragging and making up alternative facts. Other nations don't trust him, nor do they trust your people, and it costs you in trade and diplomacy. When things are going well, it's often more that your Leader is playing a political maneuver to make people THINK things are prosperous, and as a result, when things SHOULD be great, they are a little lackluster under the surface. People are often misinformed and undereducated here, but at least all that confusion makes it harder for your opponents to get any reliable intel from your people. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your people are significantly more difficult to Educate. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are significantly less profitable for all Yields. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are significantly less profitable for all Commerces. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all more unhappy, frustrated with frequently finding out they believed in a falsehood. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy periods are increased. [ICON_BULLET]All of your cities lose a trade route. Merchants resent the underhanded dealing they encounter here. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic penalty since other Leaders can see your Leader speaks from both sides of his mouth. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign Trade Routes are less profitable since your people's scams reduce the willingness of foreign merchants to engage in fair dealings with them. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are significantly harder to perform Espionage Missions in. [ICON_BULLET]The length of Golden Ages is significantly increased since your Leaders lofty claims keeps people thinking the nation is prospering even when it isn't. [ICON_BULLET]Your people take significantly less time to forgive being whipped to rush construction and training projects. They are used to being deeply disappointed in their Leader. [ICON_BULLET]Non-State religions are significantly easier to spread.

TEXT.English: Gets some espionage benefits but is not trusted. Education penalized, which can be a benefit to a leader who doesn't want people understanding what they are up to.
TEXT.French: Obtient des avantages d'espionnage mais n'est pas fiable. L'éducation est pénalisée, ce qui peut être un avantage pour un leader qui ne veut pas que les gens comprennent ce qu'ils font.

TEXT.English: Medical CT
Medical I

Positive Trait "A sick society is doomed to fail. Diseases, not other nations, are humanity's greatest threat and the role of government is to protect the people from their greatest threats" Extremely good at combating disease. Most people in this nation are as fascinated by medicine as the Leader is. Problem is, providing such excellent care and subsidizing medical research is expensive for the nation. But people are a bit more productive, being sick less often, and its easier to find healthy recruits for the military when you've been keeping them healthy all their lives. The nation doesn't weary of war quite so quickly when they feel confident their loved ones will be well cared for if injured. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]You enter a Golden Age whenever a Great Doctor is born in your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Disease is significantly reduced in all cities. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units all gain the Medical I Promotion, which enhances Healing benefits a bit and reduces Disease locally by a lot. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all healthier. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that improve your capacity to combat Disease are faster to build. [ICON_BULLET]Doctor Type Specialists get an additional Food. [ICON_BULLET]Priest and Doctor Type Specialists get an additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that open up medical knowledge are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained with an additional Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained faster. [ICON_BULLET]Great Doctors are more likely to be born in your cities. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is higher since budget is poured into Medical care and research without restraint. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Golden ages don't last as long since they are so frequent. Positive Trait "A sick society is doomed to fail. But people are a bit more productive, being sick less often, and its easier to find healthy recruits for the military when you've been keeping them healthy all their lives. The nation doesn't weary of war quite so quickly when they feel confident their loved ones will be well cared for if injured. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all significantly healthier. [ICON_BULLET]Disease is significantly reduced in all cities. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units all gain the Medical II Promotion, which enhances Healing benefits a bit and reduces Disease locally by a lot. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that improve your capacity to combat Disease are faster to build. [ICON_BULLET]Doctor Type Specialists get an additional Production. [ICON_BULLET]Doctor Type Specialists get an additional Espionage and Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that open up medical knowledge are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained with an additional few Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers from significantly less War Weariness since by taking care of their Health, they have complete faith in their Leadership to keep them safe. [ICON_BULLET]Great Doctors are significantly more likely to be born in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]Golden ages don't last as long since they are so frequent.

TEXT.English: Strong Disease Fighting and Health. A little expensive to maintain. Focused more on the clinical side of healing than overall caring for the people. Powerful healers and inspiring Doctors.
TEXT.French: Forte lutte contre les maladies et santé. Un peu cher à entretenir. Plus axé sur l'aspect clinique de la guérison que sur la prise en charge globale des personnes. Guérisseurs puissants et médecins inspirants.

TEXT.English: Meek CT
Meek I

Negative Trait "It is absolutely immoral and dangerous to go invading other nations. Large nations are far too much work anyhow! Count me out of ever taking part in such an effort." Meek leaders are better off planning to avoid having to invade. They are better off growing larger, fewer cities. It might be costly for them to maintain large empires but if they can peacefully outgrow their rivals and never have to take ground by force, they can overcome their weaknesses. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies the Meek I promotion to all Combatant units. Strong city attack penalty and a reduction in the ability to aid stability in the city. [ICON_BULLET]Military units cost even more gold to upkeep. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities construct Siege based and Siege supporting buildings slower. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that support and unlock Siege units are slower to research. [ICON_BULLET]Siege units lose experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Siege units are slower to train. [ICON_BULLET]Slight decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Distance to Capital. Planning to conquer so much territory, your people are more efficient at maintaining larger empires with larger areas. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. [ICON_BULLET]Lose an amount of Free Units based on a small percentage of the total population of your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Lose an amount of Free Military Units based on a small percentage of the total population of your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Enemies suffer less War Weariness since they do not fear losing their cities to your forces. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are slightly less likely to capture defeated enemy units since they lack a dominant mindset and often allow those retreating to escape. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are more likely to be captured when defeated because they will more readily submit to their foes. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in overall upkeep costs. [ICON_BULLET]Slightly enhanced rate of birthing Great People as autonomy, both personal and national, is respected here. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a diplomatic bonus since leaders comfortably believe you won't invade them. [ICON_BULLET]Units are slightly cheaper to upgrade because city invasion training is not part of their curriculum. [ICON_BULLET]Crime is reduced since the people value the personal freedoms they have.

[ICON_BULLET]Your units are more likely to be captured when defeated because they will more readily submit to their foes. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in overall upkeep costs. [ICON_BULLET]Enhanced rate of birthing Great People as autonomy, both personal and national, is respected here. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a diplomatic bonus since leaders comfortably believe you won't invade them. [ICON_BULLET]Units are cheaper to upgrade because city invasion training is not part of their curriculum. [ICON_BULLET]Crime is reduced since the people value the personal freedoms they have.

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "It is absolutely immoral and dangerous to go invading other nations. Large nations are far too much work anyhow! Count me out of ever taking part in such an effort." Meek leaders are better off planning to avoid having to invade. They are better off growing larger, fewer cities. It might be costly for them to maintain large empires but if they can peacefully outgrow their rivals and never have to take ground by force, they can overcome their weaknesses. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies the Meek promotion to all Combatant units. Strong city attack penalty and a reduction in the ability to aid stability in the city. [ICON_BULLET]All Units cost more gold to upkeep. [ICON_BULLET]Military units cost even more gold to upkeep. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities construct Siege based and Siege supporting buildings slower. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that support and unlock Siege units are slower to research. [ICON_BULLET]Siege units lose experience when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Siege units are slower to train. [ICON_BULLET]Decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Distance to Capital. Planning to conquer so much territory, your people are more efficient at maintaining larger empires with larger areas. [ICON_BULLET]Higher Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. [ICON_BULLET]Lose an amount of Free Units based on a small percentage of the total population of your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Lose an amount of Free Military Units based on a small percentage of the total population of your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Enemies suffer less War Weariness since they do not fear losing their cities to your forces. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are significantly less likely to capture defeated enemy units since they lack a dominant mindset and often allow those retreating to escape. [ICON_BULLET]Your units are more likely to be captured when defeated because they will more readily submit to their foes. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in overall upkeep costs. [ICON_BULLET]Enhanced rate of birthing Great People as autonomy, both personal and national, is respected here. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a diplomatic bonus since leaders comfortably believe you won't invade them. [ICON_BULLET]Units are cheaper to upgrade because city invasion training is not part of their curriculum. [ICON_BULLET]Crime is significantly reduced since the people value the personal freedoms they have.

TEXT.English: Weak city attack forces and more expensive to maintain a larger empire but some enhanced personal liberties and diplomacy and better behaved citizens.
TEXT.French: Forces d'attaque de la ville faibles et plus coûteuses pour maintenir un empire plus grand, mais certaines libertés et diplomatie personnelles améliorées et des citoyens mieux comportés.
TEXT.Russian: Ýòîò ëèäåð íå ìîæåò ïîõâàñòàòü ìîùíûìè àòàêóþùèìè áîéöàìè, à îãðîìíûå òåððèòîðèè îáõîäÿñÿ äîðîæå â ñîäåðæàíèè, çàòî íàëè÷èå øèðîêèõ ëè÷íûõ ñâîáîä è èñêóñíîé äèïëîìàòèè êîìïåíñèðóåò ýòè íåäîñòàòêè. Ïîääàííûå òàêîãî ëèäåðà áîëåå ñïîêîéíûå ïî ñðàâíåíèþ ñ äðóãèìè.

TEXT.English: Minimalist CT
Minimalist I

Negative Trait "Large nations are impossible to manage. Better to have a small, compact one that can be kept under close wraps." It might be possible that with the Win for Losing game option on, this may actually be closer to a positive trait than a negative one, despite being primarily Negative in modifiers. This leader would prefer to focus on managing a small nation well than trying much to build out that nation and expand it into an empire. It will take you a lot more effort to tame your lands. The people are slower to grow and expand and if you are too effective at it, you'll be saddled with huge expenses for doing so. However, you do benefit from people that are better at focusing on the problems they face and finding solutions to them, and on wondrous works. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer from a percentage penalty to Food and Production. [ICON_BULLET]Settlers are trained much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are trained much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements organically upgrade incredibly slower than usual, if at all. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are far slower at improving your territory. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions option, instability from the distance to capital is increased. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all generate one less base Food and Production. [ICON_BULLET]Upkeep from Distance to Capital is moderately increased. [ICON_BULLET]Upkeep from Number of Cities is moderately increased. [ICON_BULLET]You get penalized an amount of Free Units derived from a small percentage of your overall Population. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest Cities are less happy since your citizens feel burdened in highly populated areas. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military Units are a little slower to be trained since your people are in no hurry. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are constructed faster than normal since these large projects represent highly focused local efforts. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all given an additional base Research. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all benefit from a percentage modifier to Research. [ICON_BULLET]Scientist and Doctor type Specialists take their time in patient studies and thus add a Research each. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a little more defensible because your cities are constructed with patient care.

TEXT.English: Naive CT
Naive I

Negative Trait "Surely people, even world leaders, can be trusted. I don't understand all this paranoia from all my advisors!" While you are a clever leader who often misdirects his foes into strategic traps, and your spies are top notch, your people don't appreciate being lied to and being subject to intrusive investigations. Other nations are particularly suspicious of you and your people. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities produce a few less Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists are penalized an Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Your Spy units are assigned the Naive I Promotion, making them easier to catch and giving them reduced chances of escape. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are focused on Investigations and Security are slower to build. [ICON_BULLET]Spy and Investigator type Specialists cost a Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave type Specialists are penalized an Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital produces a small percentage less Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to Investigation and Security improvements are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Espionage units are trained with a few less Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Espionage units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Espionage missions are easier to perform against your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Great Spies are less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are happier since they enjoy more privacy. [ICON_BULLET]Your people suffer less War Weariness since they trust the accounts of war that they receive from the government. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy times are a little shorter since the people accept explanations of the need for change faster. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a diplomacy bonus since leaders can rely on your word. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer a bit less Crime since the people tend to follow your example of honest behavior.

TEXT.English: Poor Espionage. People are happy with an honest leader.
TEXT.French: Pauvre espionnage. Les gens sont satisfaits d'un leader honnête.

TEXT.English: Naturalist CT
Naturalist I

Positive Trait "Walk gently upon Mother Earth for our health is hers. I will not tolerate a messy society that disposes of its wastes haphazardly. We have enough to worry about without poisoning ourselves in the process of achieving our goals." Although the benefits from this trait may not be as strong for your nation in the immediate beginning of the game, being able to hit the mid-game developments without having pollution going out of control would be quite a benefit. Pollution is normally very difficult, if not impossible, to fully manage throughout certain eras, and perhaps no property can create as crippling an impact as pollution. Besides, respect for your environment pays off with happier and healthier people all throughout the game. You may see a little reduced Production but you can make up for it with creative solutions and your people know how to nurture the land so can produce a lot more food. Your people don't produce as many things for sale since they try not to take so much from the land, so Commerce is impacted some. But if you can make this trait work for you, you should feel good about yourself and your nation, for while many real cultures have attempted to possess this outlook, unfortunately many proved to lack the aggression necessary to survive the test of time. Yet today, we turn to their ways and wish greatly that we had been adopting them ourselves all along. And perhaps we will really lament not adopting these views much earlier. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities benefit from less Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities benefit from less Water Pollution. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All your units gain the Naturalist I Promotion, which makes all your units perform cleanup tasks in their downtime, therefore causing them to reduce both water and air pollution a little each. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all healthier. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all happier. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements that represent green power and revitalizing the land are built faster. [ICON_BULLET]Artist Type Specialists gain an additional Production. [ICON_BULLET]Priest Type Specialists gain an additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Celebrity and Artist Type Specialists gain an additional Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your workers are more effective at working with the land rather than against it and thus complete their builds significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest cities are Happier since community cleanup efforts are stronger where there are more citizens there to chip in and usually big cities are festering in garbage - not here! Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is higher since being responsible with industry is expensive. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer from one less base Production. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a small percentage penalty to Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher since patrols do regular garbage collections. [ICON_BULLET]Corporations are more expensive to operate under stiff emissions and waste regulations. [ICON_BULLET]The expense of rushing constructions and training is higher when your industries refuse to cut corners on cleanup. [ICON_BULLET]Access to Whales, Fur, and Lead all generate an unhappiness each since they all arouse the ire of your citizens.

[ICON_BULLET]Corporations are significantly more expensive to operate under stiff emissions and waste regulations. [ICON_BULLET]The expense of rushing constructions and training is moderately higher when your industries refuse to cut corners on cleanup. [ICON_BULLET]Access to Whales, Fur, and Lead all generate an unhappiness each since they all arouse the ire of your citizens.
TEXT.Russian: Positive Trait 'Walk gently upon Mother Earth for our health is hers. I will not tolerate a messy society that disposes of its wastes haphazardly. We have enough to worry about without poisoning ourselves in the process of achieving our goals.' Although the benefits from this trait may not be as strong for your nation in the immediate beginning of the game, being able to hit the mid-game developments without having pollution going out of control would be quite a benefit. Pollution is normally very difficult, if not impossible, to fully manage throughout certain eras, and perhaps no property can create as crippling an impact as pollution. Besides, respect for your environment pays off with happier and healthier people all throughout the game. You may see a little reduced Production but you can make up for it with creative solutions and your people know how to nurture the land so can produce a lot more food. Your people don't produce as many things for sale since they try not to take so much from the land, so Commerce is impacted some. But if you can make this trait work for you, you should feel good about yourself and your nation, for while many real cultures have attempted to possess this outlook, unfortunately many proved to lack the aggression necessary to survive the test of time. Yet today, we turn to their ways and wish greatly that we had been adopting them ourselves all along. And perhaps we will really lament not adopting these views much earlier. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All specialists produce an extra Food. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities benefit from less Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities benefit from less Water Pollution. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All your units gain the Naturalist Promotion, which makes all your units perform cleanup tasks in their downtime, therefore causing them to reduce both water and air pollution a little each. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all healthier. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all happier. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements that represent forest planting naturally upgrade far faster. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements that represent green power and revitalizing the land are built faster. [ICON_BULLET]Artist Type Specialists gain an additional Production. [ICON_BULLET]Priest Type Specialists gain an additional Research. [ICON_BULLET]Celebrity and Artist Type Specialists gain an additional Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your workers are more effective at working with the land rather than against it and thus complete their builds significantly faster. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest cities are Happier since community cleanup efforts are stronger where there are more citizens there to chip in and usually big cities are festering in garbage - not here! Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is significantly higher since being responsible with industry is expensive. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer from one less base Production. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is significantly higher since patrols do regular garbage collections. [ICON_BULLET]Corporations are significantly more expensive to operate under stiff emissions and waste regulations. [ICON_BULLET]The expense of rushing constructions and training is moderately higher when your industries refuse to cut corners on cleanup. [ICON_BULLET]Access to Whales, Fur, and Lead all generate an unhappiness each since they all arouse the ire of your citizens.

TEXT.English: Very good at combating pollution. People are happy living in cleanliness.
TEXT.French: Très bon pour lutter contre la pollution. Les gens sont heureux de vivre dans la propreté.
TEXT.Russian: Î÷åíü õîðîøî áîðåòñÿ ñ çàãðÿçíåíèåì. Ëþäè ñ÷àñòëèâû, æèâÿ â ÷èñòîòå.

TEXT.English: Negligent CT
Negligent I

Negative Trait "I really doubt anyone will ever wish to take MY cities. If they do I'll just take them back. Why build fortifications? Isn't that just going to make recapturing my cities even harder?" If you don't like worrying too much about holding your cities and would prefer to just protect them to a minimum and retaliate later if your opponents start capturing them, this is the Negative Trait of choice for you. Your people lack for caution but this leads to frazzled nerves for some. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies the Negligent I promotion to all Combatant units. Strong city defense penalty and an additional side penalty. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer a penalty to base defensive modifier due to complex strategic preparations always established and in place. [ICON_BULLET]Defenses in your cities are easier to diminish with bombardments. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Penalty to happiness in every city. Some just cannot handle the flippant state attitude about defense. [ICON_BULLET]Significant penalty to earning Great Military People when combat takes place inside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities construct Defensive buildings slower. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that form prerequisites for Defensive buildings are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Lose an amount of Free Military Units based on the total population of your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain significantly less experience when the battle takes place within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]It is easier for your opponents to perform espionage missions against you. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are somewhat more beneficial in terms of yields. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are a little more beneficial in terms of commerces. [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the amount of War Weariness you suffer. Most people are prepared for dealing with living under a new flag for a while but trust responses will be forthcoming. [ICON_BULLET]Lower Maintenance costs from Distance to Capital. Much of the upkeep costs for this were based on establishing defensive routes and plans and trained responses, all dismissed under this leadership. [ICON_BULLET]Lower Maintenance costs from Number of Cities. So much easier to get around the costs of defensive planning for lots of cities when you just don't bother with those plans. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are longer. You and your people live as carefree as possible and take revelry farther than some societies would.

TEXT.English: Negotiator CT
Negotiator I

Positive Trait "Through trade and negotiation comes the leverage for world dominance." This leader knows how to win friends and influence people and the public learns by his example. This makes trade and tourism your forte, as well as diplomacy and politics. War really isn't your 'thing' much since you usually find more cooperative ways to address matters rather than direct conflict. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All Trade Routes are significantly more productive with yields generated. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities may maintain an additional Trade Route than the normal limit. [ICON_BULLET]All Foreign Trade Routes are even more productive with yields generated. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Merchant Type Specialists generate an additional Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Trade Units are trained with a bonus Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Trade Units are trained faster. [ICON_BULLET]Civic changes cause slightly fewer rounds of Anarchy. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is reduced since your people are fast and effective at shipping and trade. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from the Number of Cities is reduced since you are able to use your diplomatic talents to keep other cities more self-sustaining with less funding from the national coffers. [ICON_BULLET]All your cities gain an additional Trade Route. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic bonus with other Leaders. They like working with someone who quickly finds strong cooperative solutions. [ICON_BULLET]Gains additional Tourism in all your cities. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Great Generals are a little slower to emerge since the military is not a heavily relied on bargaining point. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates faster since war interrupts trade routes. [ICON_BULLET]One less citizen may be drafted during a conscription action. [ICON_BULLET]Cities are less defensible since they are built more for effective routing of travel than for defense. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are easier to perform Espionage Missions in for your enemies. Your people are a talkative bunch.

[ICON_BULLET]All Foreign Trade Routes are even more productive with yields generated. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Merchant Type Specialists generate an additional Food. [ICON_BULLET]Trade Units are trained with a bonus Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Trade Units are trained faster. [ICON_BULLET]Civic changes cause slightly fewer rounds of Anarchy. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is reduced since your people are fast and effective at shipping and trade. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from the Number of Cities is reduced since you are able to use your diplomatic talents to keep other cities more self-sustaining with less funding from the national coffers. [ICON_BULLET]Corporation Maintenance is reduced since your people are very skilled merchants and advertisers who can maximize profits by driving more sales and finding where they're services are most needed. [ICON_BULLET]All your cities gain an additional Trade Route. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic bonus with other Leaders. They like working with someone who quickly finds strong cooperative solutions. [ICON_BULLET]Gains additional Tourism in all your cities. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Great Generals are a little slower to emerge since the military is not a heavily relied on bargaining point. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates faster since war interrupts trade routes. [ICON_BULLET]One less citizen may be drafted during a conscription action. [ICON_BULLET]Cities are less defensible since they are built more for effective routing of travel than for defense. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are easier to perform Espionage Missions in for your enemies. Your people are a talkative bunch.

TEXT.English: Negotiator III

Positive Trait "Through trade and negotiation comes the leverage for world dominance." This leader knows how to win friends and influence people and the public learns by his example. This makes trade and tourism your forte, as well as diplomacy and politics. War really isn't your 'thing' much since you usually find more cooperative ways to address matters rather than direct conflict. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All Trade Routes are significantly more productive with yields generated. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities may maintain additional Trade Routes than the normal limit. [ICON_BULLET]All Foreign Trade Routes are even more productive with yields generated. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Merchant Type Specialists generate an additional Production. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from the Number of Cities is reduced since you are able to use your diplomatic talents to keep other cities more self-sustaining with less funding from the national coffers. [ICON_BULLET]Corporation Maintenance is significantly reduced since your people are very skilled merchants and advertisers who can maximize profits by driving more sales and finding where they're services are most needed. [ICON_BULLET]All your cities gain an additional Trade Route. [ICON_BULLET]You gain a Diplomatic bonus with other Leaders. They like working with someone who quickly finds strong cooperative solutions. [ICON_BULLET]Gains additional Tourism in all your cities. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Great Generals are a little slower to emerge since the military is not a heavily relied on bargaining point. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates faster since war interrupts trade routes. [ICON_BULLET]One less citizen may be drafted during a conscription action. [ICON_BULLET]Cities are less defensible since they are built more for effective routing of travel than for defense. [ICON_BULLET]Military units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are significantly easier to perform Espionage Missions in for your enemies. Your people are a talkative bunch.

TEXT.English: Strong Trade benefits. A little lax on warfare, an impediment to trade. Reductions in anarchy time and upkeep. Diplomatic benefit. Espionage defense reduced as enhanced trade efforts opens up potential for infiltration. Tourism grows as you appear friendly to visitors.
TEXT.French: Avantages commerciaux importants. Un peu relâché sur la guerre, un obstacle au commerce. Réduction du temps d'anarchie et de l'entretien. Avantage diplomatique. La défense contre l'espionnage a été réduite à mesure que l'intensification des efforts commerciaux ouvre un potentiel d'infiltration. Le tourisme se développe à mesure que vous paraissez sympathique aux visiteurs.

Çàùèòà îò øïèîíàæà ñíèæàåòñÿ, ïîñêîëüêó ðàñøèðåíèå òîðãîâûõ êîíòàêòîâ îòêðûâàåò ïîòåíöèàë äëÿ ïðîíèêíîâåíèÿ ÷óæåçåìöåâ. Òóðèçì ðàñòåò, ïîñêîëüêó âàøà ñòðàíà âûãëÿäèò äðóæåëþáíîé äëÿ èíîñòðàíöåâ.

TEXT.English: Pacifist CT
TEXT.German: Pazifist

TEXT.English: Pacifist I
TEXT.German: Pazifist I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "War? What's it good for? Absolutely nothing!" This leader resents conflict and tends to live in denial that it can occasionally be necessary, or a key to achievement. He, and his people, focus more on other priorities and tend to leave themselves vulnerable as a result. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Reduction of any available Free Military units from a penalty based on the total amount of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Huge Increase in War Weariness you suffer. Your people are not merely fearful of war, but object to it as a solution. [ICON_BULLET]Strong Reduction in the speed of training all Military units. Your people object to becoming soldiers in any capacity. [ICON_BULLET]Strong Increase in the price to upgrade your units. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies Pacifist I Promotion to all Combatant units. Pacifist I is a fairly basic promotion with a relatively minor -10% combat modifier. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Improved relations with opponent leaders. They like pushovers they need not fear. [ICON_BULLET]Moderate Education bonus. The people are more focused on developing knowledge rather than on military strategy and physical prowess. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Happiness bonus. People are more cooperative and engaging with one another and are more content with life as a result.
TEXT.German: Negative Charaktereigenschaft "Ich glaube an die Gewaltlosigkeit als einziges Heilmittel." - Mohandas Karamchand (genannt Mahatma) Gandhi (1869-1948) Das Staatsoberhaupt hasst Konflikte jeglicher Art. Es vertritt die Meinung, dass Kriege absolut unnötig sind und es keinerlei Grund für die Anwendung von Gewalt gibt. Da der Anführer und sein Volk andere Prioritäten haben, vernachlässigen sie Militär und Verteidigung, was sie zu leichten Opfern für mächtige Aggressoren macht. Primäre Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung aller freien Militäreinheiten basierend auf der Gesamtbevölkerung [ICON_BULLET]Steigerung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes (Die Bevölkerung fürchtet den Krieg nicht nur, es hält ihn außerdem für sinnlos.) [ICON_BULLET]verlangsamte Ausbildung von Militäreinheiten (Es besteht im Volk keinerlei Interesse am Soldatenhandwerk.) [ICON_BULLET]Preisanstieg für die Modernisierung von Einheiten Einschränkungen für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Pazifist I Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]verbesserte Beziehungen zu anderen Staatsoberhäuptern (Sie mögen Schwächlinge, die sie nicht fürchten müssen.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhter Bildungsstand (Das Volk konzentriert sich mehr auf das Lernen und Forschen als auf militärische Ausbildung und Körperertüchtigung.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Zufriedenheit (Deine Leute arbeiten eher mit- als gegeneinander und sind deshalb zufriedener mit ihrem Leben.)

TEXT.English: Pacifist II
TEXT.German: Pazifist II

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "War? What's it good for? Absolutely nothing!" This leader resents conflict and tends to live in denial that it can occasionally be necessary, or a key to achievement. He, and his people, focus more on other priorities and tend to leave themselves vulnerable as a result. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Huge Increase in War Weariness you suffer. Your people are not merely fearful of war, but object to it as a solution. [ICON_BULLET]Reduction of any available Free Military units from a penalty based on the total amount of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Huge reduction in the speed of training all Military units. Your people object to becoming soldiers in any capacity. [ICON_BULLET]Huge increase in the price to upgrade your units. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies Pacifist II Promotion to all Combatant units. Pacifist II is a fairly basic promotion with a relatively minor -10% combat modifier. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Reduced rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Small reduction to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in overall upkeep due to a diminished focus on military training and quality assurance of national defense. [ICON_BULLET]Moderate Education bonus. The people are more focused on developing knowledge rather than on military strategy and physical prowess. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Health bonus. People tend to live safer lives with fights and conflict being infrequent. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Happiness bonus. People are more cooperative and engaging with one another and are more content with life as a result.
TEXT.German: Negative Charaktereigenschaft "Ich glaube an die Gewaltlosigkeit als einziges Heilmittel." - Mohandas Karamchand (genannt Mahatma) Gandhi (1869-1948) Das Staatsoberhaupt hasst Konflikte jeglicher Art. Es vertritt die Meinung, dass Kriege absolut unnötig sind und es keinerlei Grund für die Anwendung von Gewalt gibt. Da der Anführer und sein Volk andere Prioritäten haben, vernachlässigen sie Militär und Verteidigung, was sie zu leichten Opfern für mächtige Aggressoren macht. Primäre Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]Steigerung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes (Die Bevölkerung fürchtet den Krieg nicht nur, es hält ihn außerdem für sinnlos.) [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung aller freien Militäreinheiten basierend auf der Gesamtbevölkerung [ICON_BULLET]verlangsamte Ausbildung von Militäreinheiten (Es besteht im Volk keinerlei Interesse am Soldatenhandwerk.) [ICON_BULLET]Preisanstieg für die Modernisierung von Einheiten Einschränkungen für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Pazifist II Weitere Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]gesenkte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]Reduzierung der laufenden Kosten (Es wird nur wenig Wert auf militärisches Training und hochwertige Verteidigungsanlagen gelegt.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhter Bildungsstand (Das Volk konzentriert sich mehr auf das Lernen und Forschen als auf militärische Ausbildung und Körperertüchtigung.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Gesundheit (Das Volk lebt sicherer. Es kommt nur selten zu Raufereien und Streitigkeiten.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Zufriedenheit (Deine Leute arbeiten eher mit- als gegeneinander und sind deshalb zufriedener mit ihrem Leben.)

Es vertritt die Meinung, dass Kriege absolut unnötig sind und es keinerlei Grund für die Anwendung von Gewalt gibt. Da der Anführer und sein Volk andere Prioritäten haben, vernachlässigen sie Militär und Verteidigung, was sie zu leichten Opfern für mächtige Aggressoren macht. Primäre Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]Steigerung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes (Die Bevölkerung fürchtet den Krieg nicht nur, es hält ihn außerdem für sinnlos.) [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung aller freien Militäreinheiten basierend auf der Gesamtbevölkerung [ICON_BULLET]verlangsamte Ausbildung von Militäreinheiten (Es besteht im Volk keinerlei Interesse am Soldatenhandwerk.) [ICON_BULLET]Preisanstieg für die Modernisierung von Einheiten Einschränkungen für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Pazifist Weitere Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]gesenkte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]verbesserte Beziehungen zu anderen Staatsoberhäuptern (Sie mögen Schwächlinge, die sie nicht fürchten müssen.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhter Bildungsstand (Das Volk konzentriert sich mehr auf das Lernen und Forschen als auf militärische Ausbildung und Körperertüchtigung.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Gesundheit (Das Volk lebt sicherer. Es kommt nur selten zu Raufereien und Streitigkeiten.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Zufriedenheit (Deine Leute arbeiten eher mit- als gegeneinander und sind deshalb zufriedener mit ihrem Leben.)
TEXT.Russian: Negative Trait 'War? What's it good for? Absolutely nothing!' This leader resents conflict and tends to live in denial that war can occasionally be necessary, or a key to achievement. He, and his people, focus more on other priorities and tend to leave themselves vulnerable as a result. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Large increase in War Weariness you suffer. Your people are not merely fearful of war, but object to it as a solution. [ICON_BULLET]Strong reduction of any available Free Military units from a penalty based on the total amount of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Strong reduction in the speed of training all Military units. Your people object to becoming soldiers in any capacity. [ICON_BULLET]Strong increase in the price to upgrade your units. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies Pacifist Promotion to all Combatant units. Pacifist is a fairly basic promotion with a relatively minor -10% combat modifier. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Reduced rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Moderate reduction to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Improved relations with opponent leaders. They like pushovers they need not fear. [ICON_BULLET]Strong Education bonus. The people are more focused on developing knowledge rather than on military strategy and physical prowess. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Health bonus. People tend to live safer lives with fights and conflict being infrequent. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Happiness bonus. People are more cooperative and engaging with one another and are more content with life as a result.

TEXT.English: Allows a weak military in favor of more domestic concerns.
TEXT.French: Permet à une armée faible de favoriser des préoccupations plus nationales.
TEXT.German: Ein pazifistischer Anführer vernachlässigt das Militär und die Verteidigung zugunsten von innenpolitischen Anliegen.
TEXT.Russian: Ïåðåðàñïðåäåëåíèå ãîñóäàðñòâåííûõ ðåñóðñîâ â ïîëüçó áîëüøåãî êîëè÷åñòâà âíóòðåííèõ ïðîáëåì öåíîé ñîêðàùåíèÿ çàòðàò íà âîîðóæåííûå ñèëû.

TEXT.English: Pious CT
Pious I

Positive Trait "A man who stands for nothing falls for anything. If you believe in a Religion, you MUST live what you believe, or you actually don't believe it at all. Devotion to a faith, mind, body, and soul, is the only way to find meaning in your life." When you adopt a religion, you adopt it fully. It's not about hating rival faiths but about living the belief to the letter. That said, other faiths DO make everyone here very uncomfortable and it becomes state policy to dissuade them and run them off if the speak too loudly. You and your people enjoy incredible gifts where your state religion is spread, all the moreso if you own the Holy City for that religion. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Units are faster to train where you have your state religion. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings are faster to construct where you have your state religion. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a significant Experience point modifier boost in the Holy City of your state religion. [ICON_BULLET]Allows the nation to produce Inquisitor units once technologically unlocked, that can remove all religions but the state religion in a city. Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]All combat capable units gain the Devotion I Promotion, which gives a strong religious combat modifier, which is a combat modifier that applies as a benefit to your unit if the opponent unit is not of your religion, but as a penalty if they are. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are more stable with your religion. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Production yield. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Gold and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness is diminished due to strong faith that a higher power should favor them due to their devotion. [ICON_BULLET]Gains a significant bonus to the rate of birthing Great People wherever your state religion has spread. [ICON_BULLET]Cities with your state religion are happier. [ICON_BULLET]Units trained in cities with your state religion gain a few extra base free Experience points. [ICON_BULLET]Your state religion is easier to spread. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a happiness wherever you have access to the Incense resource. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are less stable with multiple religions present. [ICON_BULLET]A small overall Gold percent penalty in all cities. Even the government donates a percentage to the Church. [ICON_BULLET]Religious and spiritual technologies are discovered slower. The dedication to the faith the people have blinds them to new religious thought. [ICON_BULLET]Each non-state Religion in a city makes the city less happy. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates slower for your foes because they may tend to see your society as a threat to their views so are invigorated to battle you. [ICON_BULLET]Lose a small amount of free experience on units trained in Holy Cities of non-state religions. [ICON_BULLET]Non-state religions are more difficult to spread.

The dedication to the faith the people have blinds them to new religious thought. [ICON_BULLET]Religious Anarchy periods are twice as long as it takes a lot for the citizens to change their perspectives on religion. [ICON_BULLET]War Weariness accumulates slower for your foes because they may tend to see your society as a threat to their views so are invigorated to battle you. [ICON_BULLET]Lose a small amount of free experience on units trained in Holy Cities of non-state religions. [ICON_BULLET]Non-state religions are more difficult to spread.

TEXT.English: Extremely dedicated to one religion and is not agile at all at switching between them. Experiences very strong benefits for supporting the chosen state religion.
TEXT.French: Extrêmement dédié à une religion et n'est pas du tout agile pour basculer entre les deux. Expérimente des avantages très forts pour soutenir la religion d'État choisie.
TEXT.Russian: ×ðåçâû÷àéíî ïðåäàí îäíîé ðåëèãèè è âîâñå íå ñêëîíåí ïðè ïåðåêëþ÷åíèè ìåæäó íèìè. Ïîëó÷àåò î÷åíü ñèëüíûå ïðåèìóùåñòâà ïðè ïîääåðæêå âûáðàííîé ãîñóäàðñòâåííîé ðåëèãèè.

TEXT.English: Pragmatic CT
Pragmatic I

Positive Trait "People are counting on their leaders to do things right. That requires the ability to make the tough choices and to always be willing to look your real challenges right in the face without a shred of denial. Take them head on and don't pussyfoot around the fact that there will always be wolves nipping at the heels of your society. Stay away from the indulgences that plague others." This leader gets a percent bonus to all Commerces and Yields, the primary properties, Crime, Disease, and Education, are all improved, and there are some simple but effective military benefits, making this trait a solid selection for nearly any strategy or playstyle. However, there are some added expenses and delays and this trait gives the most direct and the strongest total happiness penalties among all positive traits. Nevertheless, for the Pragmatic player, this can be a good, no-frills, no bells and whistles, simple generic choice. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your Cities all gain a minor percentage modifier to Food, Production, and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Your Cities all gain a minor percentage modifier to Gold, Research, Culture, and Espionage. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your units are more thoroughly trained and start with an extra Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are slightly more well defended by practical design. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy a little less Crime. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy a little less Disease. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities benefit from a touch more Education. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all less happy since the leader does not sugarcoat the problems the nation faces and pushes his nation to achieve as much as it possibly can despite the stress it causes. [ICON_BULLET]Overall Upkeep is higher because this leader overlooks nothing and spends everything he must to get the best out of his nation. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Corporation Maintenance is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are less happy because you put a lot of strain on your strongest centers of activity to perform. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military units take slightly longer to train due to the quality you insist on in their training.
TEXT.Russian: Positive Trait 'People are counting on their leaders to do things right. That requires the ability to make the tough choices and to always be willing to look your real challenges right in the face without a shred of denial. Take them head on and don't pussyfoot around the fact that there will always be wolves nipping at the heels of your society. Stay away from the indulgences that plague others.' This leader gets a percent bonus to all Commerces and Yields, the primary properties, Crime, Disease, and Education, are all improved, and there are some simple but effective military benefits, making this trait a solid selection for nearly any strategy or playstyle. However, there are some added expenses and delays and this trait gives the most direct and the strongest total happiness penalties among all positive traits. Nevertheless, for the Pragmatic player, this can be a good, no-frills, no bells and whistles, simple generic choice. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your Cities all gain a minor percentage modifier to Food, Production, and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Your Cities all gain a minor percentage modifier to Gold, Research, Culture, and Espionage. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your units are more thoroughly trained and start with an extra Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are slightly more well defended by practical design. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy a little less Crime. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy a little less Disease. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities benefit from a touch more Education. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all less happy since the leader does not sugarcoat the problems the nation faces and pushes his nation to achieve as much as it possibly can despite the stress it causes. [ICON_BULLET]Overall Upkeep is higher because this leader overlooks nothing and spends everything he must to get the best out of his nation. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Corporation Maintenance is higher. [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are less happy because you put a lot of strain on your strongest centers of activity to perform. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military units take slightly longer to train due to the quality you insist on in their training.

TEXT.English: Gains wide ranging benefits but can be unpopular with his people as he seems to be a bit of a downer. Invests a little more than he could but gets what he pays for.
TEXT.French: Bénéficie de nombreux avantages mais peut être impopulaire auprès de son peuple car il semble être un peu déprimant. Investit un peu plus qu'il ne pouvait, mais obtient ce pour quoi il paie.

TEXT.English: Preeminent CT
Preeminent I

Positive Trait "Power starts at the center of the government and extends outwards. That which is closest to the source is the most nurtured." Both political and religious centers of power are highly favored in this leader's preferences for funding and attention. He tends to let the exterior and less magnificent cities go underfunded and they actually end up costing more as a result. Those citizens who closest to these seats of power have stronger national pride and a fervor to protect the crown. A good trait for a super-city player. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]The Capital produces more Food, Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]The Capital produces more Gold, Research, Culture and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Units trained in the capital get significantly more bonus Experience Points than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Units Trained in the Holy City of your State Religion gain significantly more bonus Experience Points than normal. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are generated faster from battles inside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are constructed faster in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, Holy City instability is diminished. [ICON_BULLET]Administrative and National Pride Buildings are faster to construct. [ICON_BULLET]Administrative and National Pride Buildings generate extra happiness in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain more experience from combat within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Holy Cities of Non-State religions produce units with a bonus to Experience Points. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, distance plays a larger role in creating instability. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a significant increase in Maintenance from Distance to Capital due to underfunding allowing problems needing attention to exacerbate. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a significant increase in the Maintenance from Number of Cities since you resent having to fund any cities that aren't of key importance and thus allows expenses to build to critical levels. [ICON_BULLET]Get one less trade route in every city since your citizens even tend to only recognize the most influential cities of the world as being on their own radar for trade. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign trade routes are less productive since your people are less interested in what happens outside their borders.

Both political and religious centers of power are highly favored in this leader's preferences for funding and attention. He tends to let the exterior and less magnificent cities go underfunded and they actually end up costing more as a result. Those citizens who closest to these seats of power have stronger national pride and a fervor to protect the crown. A good trait for a super-city player. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]The Capital produces more Food, Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]The Capital produces more Gold, Research, Culture and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Units trained in the capital get far more bonus Experience Points than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Units Trained in the Holy City of your State Religion gain far more bonus Experience Points than normal. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are generated faster from battles inside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are constructed significantly faster in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, Holy City instability is diminished. [ICON_BULLET]Administrative and National Pride Buildings are faster to construct. [ICON_BULLET]Administrative and National Pride Buildings generate extra happiness in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]The largest cities in your empire are a little happier. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain more experience from combat within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Holy Cities of Non-State religions produce units with a significant bonus to Experience Points. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolution option, distance plays a larger role in creating instability. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a huge increase in Maintenance from Distance to Capital due to underfunding allowing problems needing attention to exacerbate. [ICON_BULLET]You suffer a huge increase in the Maintenance from Number of Cities since you resent having to fund any cities that aren't of key importance and thus allows expenses to build to critical levels. [ICON_BULLET]Get one less trade route in every city since your citizens even tend to only recognize the most influential cities of the world as being on their own radar for trade. [ICON_BULLET]Foreign trade routes are significantly less productive since your people are less interested in what happens outside their borders.

TEXT.English: Benefits to both the Capital and any possessed Holy Cities but not as strongly expansive.
TEXT.French: Avantages à la fois pour la capitale et pour toutes les villes saintes possédées, mais pas aussi fortement étendues.
TEXT.Russian: Íåáîëüøèå ïðåèìóùåñòâà êàê äëÿ ñòîëèöû, òàê è äëÿ âñåõ êîíòðîëèðóåìûõ Ñâÿùåííûõ ãîðîäîâ.

TEXT.English: Progressive CT
Progressive I

Positive Trait "Human rights and dignities are the most important thing to expand upon and protect." Far from a basket of deplorables, you and your people are engaged social activists and civil rights warriors. You do all you can to ensure fair treatment in this system and you benefit from some very unique and uncommon game effects in the process. However, it is heavily advised to never whip your slaves. Your people have no tolerance for mistreatment of anyone. Slavery itself is not particularly penalized because as long as you treat people well, it's understood to just be another station in society. War should be avoided if possible and as conscientious objectors, your people are reluctant to enter into military service. Your Leader also believes that all religions should be capable of tolerating one another and should be able to bring their own unique benefits to their diverse society without bias. The benefits in this trait are so unusual and potent that there are no Primary and Secondary Benefits here, just Benefits. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]The presence of any religion gives a base benefit in yields, commerce and happiness regardless of if they are your state religion or not. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages are much longer than normal here since people so greatly rejoice in the strength of their diversity. [ICON_BULLET]Cities require less food to grow. [ICON_BULLET]You get a Free Specialist for each National Wonder in your city. [ICON_BULLET]All religions are active in your nation on the Religious Disabling option. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy a reduction in Crime. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy a reduction in Disease. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities enjoy an increase in Education. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Basic Upkeep is slightly more expensive. New progressive programs are consistently attempted and are often more costly than they prove beneficial. [ICON_BULLET]You may conscript one less citizen with a draft action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is higher since you do all you can to meet the needs of your marginalized elements of society and the more communities you have, the more this becomes an issue. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military Units take longer to train due to reluctance among the people to enlist. [ICON_BULLET]Periods of anger from whipping slaves for construction and training is much longer than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Enemy War Weariness is reduced since foes tend to think of your people as snowflakes.

TEXT.English: Numerous very unique benefits are derived from valuing Human rights. Golden Ages last a lot longer. Cities don't require as much food to grow. You gain free Specialists from Wonders. Crime, Disease and Education are improved.
TEXT.French: De nombreux avantages très uniques découlent de la valorisation des droits de l'homme. L'âge d'or dure beaucoup plus longtemps. Les villes n'ont pas besoin d'autant de nourriture pour grandir. Vous obtenez gratuitement des spécialistes des merveilles. La criminalité, les maladies et l'éducation sont améliorées.

TEXT.English: Prolific CT
Prolific I

Positive Trait "Our most sacred duty is to spread our people across the face of the Earth. Swell in numbers and we shall outperform all other competitors. Fertility and health are our greatest resources." This trait gives your city a powerful head start in population and culture and then backs that up by making your cities require less food to grow and supports greater population with happiness benefits and faster unit training. However, it can cost you directly in gold expenses, which can already be a strain on fast growing nations, and make sure you aren't just placing these faster sprouting assets for others to easily capture. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Cities start with an additional population. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities are healthier because the people are inspired to nurture one another. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all produce an extra base Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Cities require a bit less food to grow. [ICON_BULLET]Newly placed cities are given a small amount of immediate culture. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all penalized a base Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all suffer from a percentage reduction to Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Merchant and Noble type Specialists maintain enormous family clans themselves and thus end up costing you one Gold each. [ICON_BULLET]Hurrying construction and training through whipping is a travesty to population development and therefore your people hang on to anger for this for a long time.

TEXT.Russian: Positive Trait 'Our most sacred duty is to spread our people across the face of the Earth. Swell in numbers and we shall outperform all other competitors. Fertility and health are our greatest resources.' This trait gives your city a powerful head start in population and culture and then backs that up by making your cities require less food to grow and supports greater population with happiness benefits and faster unit training. However, it can cost you directly in gold expenses, which can already be a strain on fast growing nations, and make sure you aren't just placing these faster sprouting assets for others to easily capture. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Cities require much less food to grow. [ICON_BULLET]Cities start with an additional population. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities are healthier because the people are inspired to nurture one another. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all produce an extra base Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest Cities are much happier since the people in large communities feel deeply interconnected as many are related. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military units are trained significantly faster since your family oriented folk are quick to offer themselves into service to their kin. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all penalized a base Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all suffer from a percentage reduction to Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Priest and Law type Specialists promote large family clans that often need help supporting, thus end up costing you one Gold each. [ICON_BULLET]Hurrying construction and training through whipping is a travesty to population development and therefore your people hang on to anger for this for a long time. [ICON_BULLET]Hurrying construction and training with Gold is significantly more expensive than normal.

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "Our most sacred duty is to spread our people across the face of the Earth. Swell in numbers and we shall outperform all other competitors. However, it can cost you directly in gold expenses, which can already be a strain on fast growing nations, and make sure you aren't just placing these faster sprouting assets for others to easily capture. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a percentage modifier to Food and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Cities require much less food to grow. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest Cities are happier since the people in large communities feel deeply interconnected as many are related. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military units are trained faster since your family oriented folk are quick to offer themselves into service to their kin. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all penalized with a few less base Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities all suffer from a percentage reduction to Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Celebrity and Noble type Specialists promote family development early in life and thus end up costing you one Gold each. [ICON_BULLET]Hurrying construction and training through whipping is a travesty to population development and therefore your people hang on to anger for this for a long time.
