TEXT.English: Population growth benefits with some Gold penalties
TEXT.French: La croissance de la population profite de quelques pénalités d'or
TEXT.Russian: Ðîñò íàñåëåíèÿ ïðèíîñèò âûãîäó ñ íåêîòîðûìè øòðàôàìè ê äîõîäàì

TEXT.English: Slob CT
Slob I

Negative Trait "Its too much effort to clean up and it gets in the way of progress to worry about it. Nature will sort it out eventually." When your rivers run neon blue due to pollutants and air stations are installed for citizens to refill their tanks, you know you might have allowed a bit too much 'freedom' for the good of the world. But hey, you probably made a lot of money doing it so hopefully you're happy with what you've earned. Your people certainly aren't. They probably miss the trees and healthy grasslands that once produced so much food for them but now struggles to sprout weeds, let alone crops. Ok, it might not start off that bad, but hey... let's see just how many dunes we can spread across the Earth and still manage to survive as a species! Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from more Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from more Water Pollution. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All your units gain the Slob I Promotion, which makes all your units leave garbage wherever they go, thus spreading an additional Air and Water pollution in their wake each round. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all more unhealthy. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all more unhappy. [ICON_BULLET]Artist Type Specialists cost a Production. [ICON_BULLET]Celebrity and Artist Type Specialists produce one less Culture. [ICON_BULLET]You get a Diplomatic penalty since your waste tends to find and disturb the rest of the world. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is reduced since being irresponsible with industry is cheap. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a small percentage modifier to Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is reduced. [ICON_BULLET]Corporations are cheaper to operate without emissions and waste regulations. [ICON_BULLET]The cost of upkeep for each Military Unit is reduced since you don't care to cover the labor costs of cleaning up after them. [ICON_BULLET]The expense of rushing constructions and training is reduced since your industries are skilled at cutting corners to get faster results.

TEXT.English: Slob II

They probably miss the trees and healthy grasslands that once produced so much food for them but now struggles to sprout weeds, let alone crops. Ok, it might not start off that bad, but hey... let's see just how many dunes we can spread across the Earth and still manage to survive as a species! Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All specialists cost an extra Food. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from more Air Pollution. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from more Water Pollution. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All your units gain the Slob II Promotion, which makes all your units leave garbage wherever they go, thus spreading an additional Air and Water pollution in their wake each round. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all more unhealthy. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are all more unhappy. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest cities are less Happy since these Urban communities are festering in garbage. [ICON_BULLET]You get a Diplomatic penalty since your waste tends to find and disturb the rest of the world. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is reduced since being irresponsible with industry is cheap. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain a small percentage modifier to Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is reduced. [ICON_BULLET]Corporations are cheaper to operate without emissions and waste regulations. [ICON_BULLET]The cost of upkeep for each Military Unit is reduced since you don't care to cover the labor costs of cleaning up after them. [ICON_BULLET]The expense of rushing constructions and training is moderately reduced since your industries are skilled at cutting corners to get faster results.

TEXT.English: Suffers from high pollution. People are often disgusted with their own nation.
TEXT.French: Souffre d'une forte pollution. Les gens sont souvent dégoûtés de leur propre nation.
TEXT.Russian: Ñòðàäàåò îò ñèëüíîãî çàãðÿçíåíèÿ. Ëþäè ÷àñòî èñïûòûâàþò îòâðàùåíèå îò îáëèêà ñâîåé ñòðàíû.

TEXT.English: Strategist CT
Strategist I

Positive Trait "Delegation of command through intensive training is the way to superiority on the battlefield. When every soldier uses his head and heart to obtain mastery at his craft, we have a force that can win any conflict." Discipline means everything for this leader and he demands it at every level of his highly organized nation. Competency is the prime directive he issues from his place of rule and although it does cost him in a number of ways, he finds the return in value very worthwhile. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Experience points to all units. [ICON_BULLET]Less Experience required for units to gain levels. [ICON_BULLET]Small percentage modifier of bonus experience points assigned to units trained in the capital. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Get a Golden Age whenever a Great General is born to your nation. [ICON_BULLET]Get a free Great General whenever you advance an Era. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Enhancement to the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Further enhancement to the rate of earning Great Military People when experience accumulated towards that goal is earned within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Military Training Buildings are cheaper to build. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that bring military training benefits are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain more experience when they fight inside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Slightly increased Defense against Espionage due to the improved level of discipline, and thus care taken with procedure, at every level of command. [ICON_BULLET]Great Generals are a little more likely to be born as normal Great People. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Slightly reduced rate of earning standard Great People. The importance placed on discipline suppresses the creative genius in some individuals that may have otherwise become powerfully influential. [ICON_BULLET]Military units cost more to train due to the increased efforts and costs involved in training them to such a degree of enhanced excellence. [ICON_BULLET]Since Golden Ages are far more common, they last a quarter less rounds when they take place. People don't remain impressed with their society as long. [ICON_BULLET]More expensive to upgrade units since they are more specialized and have greater demands on their quality.

[ICON_BULLET]More expensive to upgrade units since they are more specialized and have greater demands on their quality.

TEXT.English: Strategist III

Positive Trait "Delegation of command through intensive training is the way to superiority on the battlefield. When every soldier uses his head and heart to obtain mastery at his craft, we have a force that can win any conflict." Discipline means everything for this leader and he demands it at every level of his highly organized nation. Competency is the prime directive he issues from his place of rule and although it does cost him in a number of ways, he finds the return in value very worthwhile. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Experience points to all units. [ICON_BULLET]Less Experience required for units to gain levels. [ICON_BULLET]Significant percentage modifier of bonus experience points assigned to units trained in the capital. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Get a Golden Age whenever a Great Aviator is born to your nation. (Pending) [ICON_BULLET]Get a free Great Aviator whenever you advance an Era. (Pending) Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Significant enhancement to the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Further enhancement to the rate of earning Great Military People when experience accumulated towards that goal is earned within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Military Training Buildings are cheaper to build. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that bring military training benefits are faster to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your units gain more experience when they fight inside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Increased Defense against Espionage due to the improved level of discipline, and thus care taken with procedure, at every level of command. [ICON_BULLET]Great Generals are significantly more likely to be born as normal Great People. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Reduced rate of earning standard Great People. The importance placed on discipline suppresses the creative genius in some individuals that may have otherwise become powerfully influential. [ICON_BULLET]Military units cost more to train due to the increased efforts and costs involved in training them to such a degree of enhanced excellence. [ICON_BULLET]Since Golden Ages are far more common, they last a quarter less rounds when they take place. People don't remain impressed with their society as long. [ICON_BULLET]More expensive to upgrade units since they are more specialized and have greater demands on their quality.

TEXT.English: Quality over quantity. Highest priority is an experience driven military led by masterful commanders.
TEXT.French: La qualité plutôt que la quantité. La plus haute priorité est une expérience militaire dirigée par des commandants magistraux.
TEXT.Russian: Êà÷åñòâî âàæíåå êîëè÷åñòâà. Íàèâûñøèì ïðèîðèòåòîì ÿâëÿåòñÿ íàëè÷èå îïûòíûõ áîéöîâ âî ãëàâå ñ èñêóñíûìè êîìàíäèðàìè.

TEXT.English: Stubborn CT
Stubborn I

Negative Trait "It requires careful, meticulous planning to run an empire and all these people wanting me to focus on all of these things need to just quiet down on their enthusiasm. I'll get to it all when I'm damned good and ready!" This leader has his own way of doing things and puts importance on the most basic things taking place in his empire. He does not care to try to leave a huge legacy and is very patient when making his demands. People often resist doing what he wishes and go about those things with less exuberance, and the results show in the end. He more thoroughly trains his military and it makes them hard to improve with later developments. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders, National Wonders, and Team Projects are constructed far slower than usual. [ICON_BULLET]Rushing construction and training costs much more than normal. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that speed up construction and training are constructed slower. [ICON_BULLET]Techs that give benefits for being first to research them are discovered slower. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy periods last longer because your Leader won't tolerate any disagreements and must root out all resistance to his policy changes. [ICON_BULLET]Improvements naturally upgrade far slower. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Thanks to difficulties working under your policies, your workforce is less effective and you are penalized a Free Specialist as a result. [ICON_BULLET]Military Units are slower to train due to thorough training regimens. [ICON_BULLET]Units are more expensive to upgrade since they are harder to teach new ways to fight. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Trade Route profits are increased for Food yields. [ICON_BULLET]Units begin with one more Experience Point due to thorough training. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation naturally supports an increased amount of Free Units based on a small percentage of the overall total population. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages last longer because the Leader is slower to let things get back to normal.

[ICON_BULLET]Improvements naturally upgrade far slower. [ICON_BULLET]Workers are much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Thanks to difficulties working under your policies, your workforce is less effective and you are penalized a Free Specialist as a result. [ICON_BULLET]Military Units are moderately slower to train due to thorough training regimens. [ICON_BULLET]Units are moderately more expensive to upgrade since they are harder to teach new ways to fight. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Trade Route profits are increased for Commerce yields. [ICON_BULLET]This nation suffers less War Weariness since this leader has unshakeable confidence. [ICON_BULLET]Units begin with one more Experience Point due to thorough training. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation naturally supports an increased amount of Free Units based on a small percentage of the overall total population. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are marginally easier to defend since the defenses are built to respond to all possible threats. [ICON_BULLET]Golden Ages last longer because the Leader is slower to let things get back to normal.

TEXT.English: A lot gets done a lot slower in this empire but there are a few places where the extra care and attention can pay off. This leader almost seems to balk at all suggestions and thus avoid good decisions specifically because others want him to make them.
TEXT.French: Beaucoup se fait beaucoup plus lentement dans cet empire, mais il y a quelques endroits où le soin et l'attention supplémentaires peuvent porter leurs fruits. Ce leader semble presque reculer devant toutes les suggestions et éviter ainsi les bonnes décisions, notamment parce que d'autres veulent qu'il les fasse.

TEXT.English: Timid CT
TEXT.German: Schüchtern

TEXT.English: Timid I
TEXT.German: Schüchtern I

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Me? Attack someone else? No... no... initiating a war is just too great a risk and morally wrong." While this trait will hobble your nation in offensive war efforts, it does give you some defensive benefits and makes war less likely to be thrust upon you. If you can compensate in other ways, like outgrowing your opponents, you might be able to succeed despite this painful set of penalties. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Inflicts War Weariness upon enemy players slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Increased cost of upkeep per military unit. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies the Timid I promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large attack penalty but a small defense bonus. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants lose a few Experience points when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants take longer to train. The people are culturally resistant to the idea of being in the military. [ICON_BULLET]You accumulate significantly more War Weariness than usual. [ICON_BULLET]Small decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Lose some Free Military Units if you are getting some from other sources. [ICON_BULLET]Slightly less likely to capture enemy units when defeating them. Your troops often let surviving enemies flee. [ICON_BULLET]Units are more likely to be captured when defeated. Your units will more readily surrender to be taken alive. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the rate of earning Great Military People on combats that take place inside your borders. Enough to counter the penalty you get overall so that the penalty really ONLY applies when the battle is outside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the amount of experience earned during fights within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Slightly improved base city defense level. [ICON_BULLET]Bonus to diplomacy. It's very comforting to other leaders to believe it's unlikely you're going to ever attack them, or anyone else for that matter. [ICON_BULLET]Less expensive to upgrade units. Retraining simpler units that act more effectively at harnessing their terror than tapping into anger and hate is less costly.
TEXT.German: Negative Charaktereigenschaft "Es gibt eine Grenze, wo Zurückhaltung aufhört, eine Tugend zu sein." - Edmund Burke (1729-1797) Obwohl diese Charaktereigenschaft dir Steine bei eventuellen Kriegsbestrebungen in den Weg legt, bringt sie doch auch unbestreitbare defensive Vorteile und sorgt dafür, dass deine Nation wesentlich seltener in bewaffnete Auseinandersetzungen verwickelt wird. Wem es gelingt, die üblen Nachteile anderweitig zu kompensieren, etwa durch technologische Fortschritte oder kulturelle Ausbreitung, der kann durchaus auch als schüchterner Anführer siegreich sein. Primäre Nachteile:: [ICON_BULLET]verzögerte Kriegsmüdigkeit bei gegnerischen Nationen [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte laufende Kosten für militärische Einheiten Einschränkungen für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Schüchtern I Weitere Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]gesenkte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten beim Training weniger Erfahrungspunkte [ICON_BULLET]verzögertes Training für Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten (Die Bevölkerung hat keine Erfahrung mit Auseinandersetzungen und ist dementsprechend untrainiert.) [ICON_BULLET]Steigerung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes [ICON_BULLET]Senkung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können [ICON_BULLET]weniger freie Einheiten, für die keine laufenden Kosten anfallen [ICON_BULLET]geringere Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme gegnerischer Einheiten (Deine Truppen lassen überlebende Gegner eher entkommen.) [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Wahrscheinlichkeit für die Gefangennahme eigener Einheiten (Deine Truppen hängen am Leben und ergeben sich eher.) Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]normale Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren bei Gefechten innerhalb der eigenen Grenzen (Der Bonus für Gefechte außerhalb der eigenen Grenzen wird gerade aufgehoben.) [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der Erfahrungspunkte für Gefechte innerhalb der eigenen Grenzen [ICON_BULLET]verbesserte Stadtverteidigung [ICON_BULLET]Vorteile bei diplomatischen Verhandlungen (Andere Staatsoberhäupter fühlen sich wohler, wenn sie nicht ständig mit Angriffen rechnen müssen.) [ICON_BULLET]Preissenkung für die Modernisierung von Einheiten (Da weniger Wert auf die neuesten Taktiken und Tötungsarten gelegt wird, werden Kosten gespart.)
TEXT.Russian: Negative Trait 'Me? Attack someone else? Noâ�� noâ�� initiating a war is just too great a risk and morally wrong.' While this trait will hobble your nation in offensive war efforts, it does give you some defensive benefits and makes war less likely to be thrust upon you. If you can compensate in other ways, like outgrowing your opponents, you might be able to succeed despite this painful set of penalties. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Inflicts War Weariness upon enemy players slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Increased cost of upkeep per military unit. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies the Timid I promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large attack penalty but a small defense bonus. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants lose a few Experience points when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants take longer to train. The people are culturally resistant to the idea of being in the military. [ICON_BULLET]You accumulate significantly more War Weariness than usual. [ICON_BULLET]Small decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Lose some Free Military Units if you are getting some from other sources. [ICON_BULLET]Slightly less likely to capture enemy units when defeating them. Your troops often let surviving enemies flee. [ICON_BULLET]Units are more likely to be captured when defeated. Your units will more readily surrender to be taken alive. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the rate of earning Great Military People on combats that take place inside your borders. Enough to counter the penalty you get overall so that the penalty really ONLY applies when the battle is outside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the amount of experience earned during fights within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Slightly improved base city defense level. [ICON_BULLET]Bonus to diplomacy. It's very comforting to other leaders to believe it's unlikely you're going to ever attack them, or anyone else for that matter. [ICON_BULLET]Less expensive to upgrade units. Retraining simpler units that act more effectively at harnessing their terror than tapping into anger and hate is less costly.

TEXT.English: Timid II
TEXT.German: Schüchtern II

TEXT.English: Negative Trait "Me? Attack someone else? No... no... initiating a war is just too great a risk and morally wrong." While this trait will hobble your nation in offensive war efforts, it does give you some defensive benefits and makes war less likely to be thrust upon you. If you can compensate in other ways, like outgrowing your opponents, you might be able to succeed despite this painful set of penalties. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Inflicts War Weariness upon enemy players much slower than normal. [ICON_BULLET]Increased cost of upkeep per military unit. [ICON_BULLET]You accumulate far more War Weariness than usual. Unique Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Applies the Timid II promotion to all Combatant and Naval Combatant units. Gives a large attack penalty but a small defense bonus. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Decrease in the rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People city specialists lose two Gold each. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants lose Experience points when trained. [ICON_BULLET]Combatants and Naval Combatants take longer to train. The people are culturally resistant to the idea of being in the military. [ICON_BULLET]Decrease to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Lose some Free Military Units if you are getting some from other sources. [ICON_BULLET]Slightly less likely to capture enemy units when defeating them. Your troops often let surviving enemies flee. [ICON_BULLET]Units are more likely to be captured when defeated. Your units will more readily surrender to be taken alive. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the rate of earning Great Military People on combats that take place inside your borders. Enough to counter the penalty you get overall so that the penalty really ONLY applies when the battle is outside your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Increase in the amount of experience earned during fights within your borders. [ICON_BULLET]Improved base city defense level. [ICON_BULLET]Bonus to diplomacy. It's very comforting to other leaders to believe it's unlikely you're going to ever attack them, or anyone else for that matter. [ICON_BULLET]Less expensive to upgrade units. Retraining simpler units that act more effectively at harnessing their terror than tapping into anger and hate is less costly.

TEXT.English: Gains some diplomatic bonus at the cost of having weak units - particularly on the attack. A little bit stronger when backed into a corner though.
TEXT.French: Gagne un bonus diplomatique au prix d'avoir des unités faibles - en particulier sur l'attaque. Un peu plus fort quand on est dans un coin cependant.
TEXT.German: Schüchterne Anführer haben es bei diplomatischen Verhandlungen etwas leichter. Leider sorgt ihr zögerliches Verhalten aber für eine Schwächung des Militärs. Besonders im Angriff sind ihre Einheiten anderen deutlich unterlegen. In die Ecke gedrängt, können sie aber immer noch zu formidablen Gegnern werden.

TEXT.English: Traditional CT
Traditional I

Negative Trait "We already know everything we need to know! Stick to tradition or we'll lose our way!" You might feel this is clearly the worst selection for all Negative Traits but it's actually been a historically common way to see things for people. Change can be frightening and discoveries bring change. There are some significant benefits to offset the obvious hindrance of researching slower, but you can also overcome your impediment in other ways, such as enhanced Commerce levels elsewhere, taking the scientific achievements from your conquered enemy cities, stealing technologies with espionage, or simply out-expanding your rivals. This is a fairly happy people that can be much more stable for you if you give them the reliability they desire. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities are penalized a couple less base Research. [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Research. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists cost a Research. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less Healthy since the people tend to stoically deny any need for treatment, not trusting what they don't understand. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation generates Great People slower. Those with new ideas tend to suffer mockery and mistrust. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are focused on Science and Research are slower to build. [ICON_BULLET]Scientist type Specialists generate one less Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave type Specialists cost a Research. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital generates a percentage less Research. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to developments in Science and Research are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy time is increased since your people resent any changes. [ICON_BULLET]Religious Anarchy time is greatly increased since your people are stubbornly fixed in their ways. [ICON_BULLET]Great Scientists are less likely to be born. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Your largest cities are happier since urban living promises more reliable patterns day to day. [ICON_BULLET]All cities gain an extra free specialist because the people obtain a higher degree of mastery through reliable routines. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a bit easier to Educate since your people don't fear their knowledge being obsoleted by new discoveries.

TEXT.English: Poor Research, slow to recover from anarchy inducing changes, and Great People emergence is weak, as pushing in a new direction is frowned upon. But the people feel content and secure and do get efficient, being well practiced with the existing knowledge and methods, resulting in free specialists and some education benefit.
TEXT.French: Pauvre recherche, lent à se remettre de changements induisant l'anarchie, et l'émergence de Great People est faible, car pousser dans une nouvelle direction est mal vu. Mais les gens se sentent satisfaits et en sécurité et deviennent efficaces, étant bien entraînés avec les connaissances et les méthodes existantes, ce qui donne des spécialistes gratuits et certains avantages éducatifs.

Íî ïðè ýòîì íàðîä ÷óâñòâóåò ñåáÿ äîâîëüíûì, çàùèùåííûì è ìîæåò ýôåêòèâíî òðóäèòüñÿ â ðàìêàõ ñóùåñòâóþùèõ çíàíèé è îïûòà æèçíè ïðîøëûõ ïîêîëåíèé, ÷òî ïðèâîäèò ê ïîÿâëåíèþ áåñïëàòíûõ ñïåöèàëèñòîâ è íåáîëüøîìó ðîñòó ãðàìîòíîñòè íàñåëåíèÿ.

TEXT.English: Unrefined CT
Unrefined I

Negative Trait "Arts and Culture are worthless distractions to achieving dominance." If you've ever felt that you could forego the value of culture, you are welcome to try working with a leader with this negative trait. There are some benefits, like reduced upkeep, but the loss of cultural output should make it apparent how valuable culture can be. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities produce a few less base Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All cities lose a percentage penalty to Culture. [ICON_BULLET]All Specialists produce one less Culture. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less happy since artistic expression is devalued. [ICON_BULLET]Great People are slower to emerge since personal expression is frowned upon. [ICON_BULLET]World Wonders are slower to construct since such projects seem frivolous. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that are primarily for generating Culture are constructed slower. [ICON_BULLET]Artist type Specialists produce one less Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen and Slave type Specialists are penalized a Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital loses a small percentage less Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that lead to Cultural development are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Entertainer units are trained with one less Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Entertainer units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Great Artists are less likely to be born. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer a bit more Crime. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Overall upkeep is lower since you deny funding anything that isn't absolutely functional. [ICON_BULLET]All Combatant units you train gain an additional Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers less War Weariness since they are a stoic folk. [ICON_BULLET]Your workers are significantly faster at building improvements as they make them strong and simple. [ICON_BULLET]Your draft actions conscript an additional citizen. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a little harder to attack since architectural design considers structural integrity paramount. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military Units are a little faster to train. [ICON_BULLET]Your enemies suffer more War Weariness, knowing your people are tough and rugged. [ICON_BULLET]When you defeat enemy units, you are a bit more likely to capture them.

[ICON_BULLET]Your workers are significantly faster at building improvements as they make them strong and simple. [ICON_BULLET]Your draft actions conscript an additional citizen. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are a little harder to attack since architectural design considers structural integrity paramount. [ICON_BULLET]Your Military Units are a little faster to train. [ICON_BULLET]Your enemies suffer more War Weariness, knowing your people are tough and rugged. [ICON_BULLET]When you defeat enemy units, you are a bit more likely to capture them.
TEXT.Russian: Negative Trait 'Arts and Culture are worthless distractions to achieving dominance.' TEXT.English: Poor Culture People are unhappy lacking for identity and expression. But they are roughshod by nature as a result.

TEXT.English: Unsanitary CT
Unsanitary I

Negative Trait "Let the people get sick so they can figure out how not to. Besides, we can turn our diseased against our enemies who are weak in their sterile environments." There can be an advantage to allowing disease to plague your nation without offering it much resistance. The people CAN end up stronger, those who survive the outbreaks anyhow. Generally speaking, it is not considered a great way to run things in a country, however, and it certainly leads to public resentment. It's certainly cheaper at least. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are significantly more Unhealthy. [ICON_BULLET]Disease is significantly increased in all cities. Unique Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]Most stealthy unit types and animal units all gain the Unsanitary I Promotion, which causes the promoted units to spread the Disease Property. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less Happy thanks to resent for the toll that frequent rampant disease takes on their lives and those of loved ones. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that improve your capacity to combat Disease are slower to build. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen Type Specialists produce one less Production. [ICON_BULLET]Scientist and Doctor Type Specialists generate one less Research. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that open up medical knowledge are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained with one less Experience Point. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained slower. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers from more War Weariness since your people don't feel you have their best interests at heart. [ICON_BULLET]Great Doctors are less likely to be born in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities require a little more food to grow thanks to a much higher mortality rate. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is cheaper since budgeting for medical care is of no governmental concern. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is lower. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is lower. [ICON_BULLET]Your people let go of anger tremendously faster from whip rushing construction and training since life has much less meaning in a sick society.
Unsanitary II

Negative Trait "Let the people get sick so they can figure out how not to. Besides, we can turn our diseased against our enemies who are weak in their sterile environments." There can be an advantage to allowing disease to plague your nation without offering it much resistance. The people CAN end up stronger, those who survive the outbreaks anyhow. Generally speaking, it is not considered a great way to run things in a country, however, and it certainly leads to public resentment. It's certainly cheaper at least. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less Happy thanks to resent for the toll that frequent rampant disease takes on their lives and those of loved ones. [ICON_BULLET]Buildings that improve your capacity to combat Disease are slower to build. [ICON_BULLET]Slave Type Specialists produce one less Production. [ICON_BULLET]Doctor Type Specialists generate one less Espionage and Gold. [ICON_BULLET]Technologies that open up medical knowledge are slower to discover. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained with a few less Experience Points. [ICON_BULLET]Your Healer units are trained significantly slower. [ICON_BULLET]Your nation suffers from significantly more War Weariness since your people don't feel you have their best interests at heart. [ICON_BULLET]Your Largest Cities are less Happy since infectious diseases hit larger populations more regularly. [ICON_BULLET]Great Doctors are significantly less likely to be born in your cities. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities require a little more food to grow thanks to a much higher mortality rate. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Generic Upkeep is significantly cheaper since budgeting for medical care is of no governmental concern. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Distance to Capital is lower. [ICON_BULLET]Maintenance from Number of Cities is lower. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities gain one trade route since there is no effort to control travel.

TEXT.English: Usurper CT
Usurper I

Negative Trait "Let the people of the land rejoice! For I have liberated them from the weak leaders they relied upon before my arrival. The power of this position is now mine to wield and we have a lot more conquering ahead of us!" This leader has taken command by force and the people resent him for bypassing due process and disposing of the original leadership. You may be able to enjoy some very strong military benefits, but if you select this trait, do ALL you can to avoid running out of specialist slots and land to work because citizens will cost you far more than they generate thanks to the will to undermine and rebel that exists among those who don't have much to lose to oppose you. Better to keep your population whipped down to a manageable size, or at least openly angry and unhappy than pretending to do you any favors. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]All cities suffer a percentage penalty to Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Citizen Type Specialists cost a Production. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are less happy, resentful of the way your leader took power. [ICON_BULLET]National Wonders are slower to construct due to a complete lack of national pride. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions option, your cities are less stable and more likely to revolt. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities lose a base Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital suffers a percentage penalty to Food, Production and Commerce. [ICON_BULLET]Your Capital suffers a percentage penalty to Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities are slightly easier to perform Espionage Missions against since many citizens would help your foes if they feel they can get away with it. [ICON_BULLET]Your cities suffer from a bit more Crime since many citizens wish to foment revolt against you. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]General Upkeep is reduced due to the elimination of a lot of government staff. [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People emerge significantly faster in this nation since your leader came to power relying on some key military figures. [ICON_BULLET]Civic Anarchy time is greatly reduced since resistance to policy changes is met with the punishment of death.

Large national instability problems. Less government expenses as bureaucracy has been eliminated so all authority is focused on new leader. The nation is ashamed of itself (-Culture) and economic uncertainty is high (-Gold).

TEXT.English: Warmonger CT
TEXT.German: Kriegstreiber

TEXT.English: Warmonger I
TEXT.German: Kriegstreiber I

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "War is the way of the world. Only by being stronger than all others can we obtain peace." This leader is intensely focused on the efficient and effective training of the basics of warfare and promotes a martial culture throughout his empire. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Military units from a bonus earned by the total amount of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Greatly improved speed of training all Military units. [ICON_BULLET]Strong Reduction in the price of upgrading your units. Unique Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]Free Combat I Promotion to all Combatant units. While Combat I is a fairly basic promotion with a relatively minor +10% combat modifier, it is a major prerequisite for other promotions and therefore places your units closer to more specialized abilities. [ICON_BULLET]All cities will use food as production when units are being trained. This reduces the growth rate in those cities significantly, but also increases the speed you produce your units and helps you take advantage of highly food producing regions for military preparedness. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increased rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Reduction in War Weariness you suffer. Your people embrace the idea that war will help them achieve their aims personally. [ICON_BULLET]Small improvement to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Increased Upkeep from the costs of providing the programs your nation needs to obtain these benefits. [ICON_BULLET]Moderate Education penalty. The people are more focused on developing personal prowess than on studies. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Health Penalty. The fascination with combat and fighting increases rates of injury and mortality.
TEXT.German: Positive Charaktereigenschaft "Je stärker wir sind, desto unwahrscheinlicher ist der Krieg." - Otto von Bismarck (1815 - 1898) Dieser Anführer ist nur auf den Ausbau und das Training seines Militärs fokussiert. Sein martialischer Führungsstil sorgt dafür, dass in der ganzen Gesellschaft Kampf und Auseinandersetzungen im Vordergrund stehen. Primäre Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der freien Militäreinheiten basierend auf der Gesamtbevölkerung [ICON_BULLET]beschleunigte Ausbildung von Militäreinheiten [ICON_BULLET]Preissenkung für die Modernisierung von Einheiten Vorteile für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Rang I - Leutnant [ICON_BULLET]alle Städte nutzen [ICON_FOOD] als [ICON_PRODUCTION], wenn Einheiten ausgebildet werden (beschleunigte Einheitenproduktion zum Preis eines stark verlangsamten Stadtwachstums) Weitere Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes (Die Bevölkerung empfindet den Krieg als beste Variante, um die eigenen Ziele zu erreichen.) [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte laufende Kosten für die Gesellschaft [ICON_BULLET]verminderter Bildungsstand (Das Volk konzentriert sich mehr auf Körperertüchtigung und Kampf als auf das Lernen und Forschen.) [ICON_BULLET]verminderte Gesundheit (Die Kampfeslust führt zu häufigeren Verletzungen und einer höheren Sterblichkeit.)

TEXT.English: Warmonger II
TEXT.German: Kriegstreiber II

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "War is the way of the world. Only by being stronger than all others can we obtain peace." This leader is intensely focused on the efficient and effective training of the basics of warfare and promotes a martial culture throughout his empire. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Huge Reduction in War Weariness you suffer. Your people embrace the idea that war will help them achieve their aims personally. [ICON_BULLET]Free Military units from a bonus earned by the total amount of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Strong improvement to the speed of training all Military units. [ICON_BULLET]Strong Reduction in the price of upgrading your units. Unique Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Free Combat II Promotion to all Combatant units. While Combat II is a fairly basic promotion with a relatively minor +10% combat modifier, it is a major prerequisite for other promotions and therefore places your units closer to more specialized abilities. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Increased rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Moderate improvement to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Increased Upkeep from the costs of providing the programs your nation needs to obtain these benefits. [ICON_BULLET]Moderate Education penalty. The people are more focused on developing personal prowess than on studies. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Health Penalty. The fascination with combat and fighting increases rates of injury and mortality. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Happiness Penalty. The competitiveness and high value placed on martial superiority leaves many feeling marginalized and suppressed.
TEXT.German: Positive Charaktereigenschaft "Je stärker wir sind, desto unwahrscheinlicher ist der Krieg." - Otto von Bismarck (1815 - 1898) Dieser Anführer ist nur auf den Ausbau und das Training seines Militärs fokussiert. Sein martialischer Führungsstil sorgt dafür, dass in der ganzen Gesellschaft Kampf und Auseinandersetzungen im Vordergrund stehen. Primäre Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes (Die Bevölkerung empfindet den Krieg als beste Variante, um die eigenen Ziele zu erreichen.) [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der freien Militäreinheiten basierend auf der Gesamtbevölkerung [ICON_BULLET]beschleunigte Ausbildung von Militäreinheiten [ICON_BULLET]Preissenkung für die Modernisierung von Einheiten Vorteile für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Rang II - Oberleutnant Weitere Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte laufende Kosten für die Gesellschaft [ICON_BULLET]verminderter Bildungsstand (Das Volk konzentriert sich mehr auf Körperertüchtigung und Kampf als auf das Lernen und Forschen.) [ICON_BULLET]verminderte Gesundheit (Die Kampfeslust führt zu häufigeren Verletzungen und einer höheren Sterblichkeit.) [ICON_BULLET]verminderte Zufriedenheit (Da in der Gesellschaft die körperlich Überlegenen besser angesehen sind und ein starker Wettbewerb herrscht, fühlen sich viele Bürger ausgegrenzt und unterdrückt.)

TEXT.English: Positive Trait "War is the way of the world. Only by being stronger than all others can we obtain peace." This leader is intensely focused on the efficient and effective training of the basics of warfare and promotes a martial culture throughout his empire. Primary Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Large reduction in War Weariness you suffer. Your people embrace the idea that war will help them achieve their aims personally. [ICON_BULLET]Strong amount of Free Military units from a bonus earned by the total amount of your overall population. [ICON_BULLET]Huge improvement to the speed of training all Military units. [ICON_BULLET]Huge reduction in the price to upgrade your units. Unique Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]Free Combat I Promotion to all Combatant units. While Combat I is a fairly basic promotion with a relatively minor +10% combat modifier, it is a major prerequisite for other promotions and therefore places your units closer to more specialized abilities. [ICON_BULLET]All cities will use food as production when units are being trained. This reduces the growth rate in those cities significantly, but also increases the speed you produce your units and helps you take advantage of highly food producing regions for military preparedness. Side Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Enhanced rate of earning Great Military People. [ICON_BULLET]Moderate improvement to the maximum number of population you convert to units during a Conscription action in a city. Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]Increased Upkeep from the costs of providing the programs your nation needs to obtain these benefits. [ICON_BULLET]Strong Education penalty. The people are more focused on developing personal prowess than on studies. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Health Penalty. The fascination with combat and fighting increases rates of injury and mortality. [ICON_BULLET]Minor Happiness Penalty. The competitiveness and high value placed on martial superiority leaves many feeling marginalized and suppressed.
TEXT.German: Positive Charaktereigenschaft "Je stärker wir sind, desto unwahrscheinlicher ist der Krieg." - Otto von Bismarck (1815 - 1898) Dieser Anführer ist nur auf den Ausbau und das Training seines Militärs fokussiert. Sein martialischer Führungsstil sorgt dafür, dass in der ganzen Gesellschaft Kampf und Auseinandersetzungen im Vordergrund stehen. Primäre Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]Verminderung der Kriegsmüdigkeit des eigenen Volkes (Die Bevölkerung empfindet den Krieg als beste Variante, um die eigenen Ziele zu erreichen.) [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der freien Militäreinheiten basierend auf der Gesamtbevölkerung [ICON_BULLET]beschleunigte Ausbildung von Militäreinheiten [ICON_BULLET]Preissenkung für die Modernisierung von Einheiten Vorteile für Einheiten: [ICON_BULLET]alle Kämpfer- und Marineeinheiten erhalten automatisch die Beförderung Rang I - Leutnant [ICON_BULLET]alle Städte nutzen [ICON_FOOD] als [ICON_PRODUCTION], wenn Einheiten ausgebildet werden (beschleunigte Einheitenproduktion zum Preis eines stark verlangsamten Stadtwachstums) Weitere Vorteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte Geburtenrate für Große Feldherren [ICON_BULLET]Erhöhung der Anzahl an neuen Militäreinheiten, die über Einberufungsaktionen gewonnen werden können Nachteile: [ICON_BULLET]erhöhte laufende Kosten für die Gesellschaft [ICON_BULLET]verminderter Bildungsstand (Das Volk konzentriert sich mehr auf Körperertüchtigung und Kampf als auf das Lernen und Forschen.) [ICON_BULLET]verminderte Gesundheit (Die Kampfeslust führt zu häufigeren Verletzungen und einer höheren Sterblichkeit.) [ICON_BULLET]verminderte Zufriedenheit (Da in der Gesellschaft die körperlich Überlegenen besser angesehen sind und ein starker Wettbewerb herrscht, fühlen sich viele Bürger ausgegrenzt und unterdrückt.)

TEXT.English: Military concept with a balanced strategy focused on high volume forces with improved training.
TEXT.French: Concept militaire avec une stratégie équilibrée axée sur des forces à fort volume avec un entraînement amélioré.
TEXT.German: Kriegstreiber legen ihr Hauptaugenmerk auf ein starkes, gut ausgebildetes Militär. Jeder Überschuss an Gold wird in die Entwicklung und den Bau neuer Kriegsmaschinen und das Training neuer Einheiten investiert.

TEXT.English: Zealous CT
Zealous I

Negative Trait "Our gods are the ONLY gods and those who believe otherwise have earned their wrath and deserve to die!" This leader takes his faith to a dramatically unhealthy level of devotion. He likely suffers from cognitive dissonance as he uses his faith to justify all manner of violence and hatred, even though his faith may at its core promote peace and harmony. His people live in fear that if they are not devout, they will run afoul of harsh laws and penalties. But they live in even greater fear of the extremely demanding role they can fall into as religious leaders. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]The anarchy time to change religions is twice as long as normal. [ICON_BULLET]For every non-state religion in a city, you suffer from an additional unhappiness. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a penalty to diplomacy since other leaders fear, and find irritating, your desire to force your religious views on others. [ICON_BULLET]Lose a percentage amount of free experience on units trained in Holy Cities of non-state religions. [ICON_BULLET]When playing with the Religious Disabling option, all Non-State Religions are inactive, and, depending on civics, if they also bar Non-State Religions, their buildings are destroyed rather than simply disabled. Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]All combat capable units gain the Devotion I promotion, which gives a strong religious combat modifier, which is a combat modifier that applies as a benefit to your unit if the opponent unit is not of your religion, but as a penalty if they are. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are less stable with multiple religions present. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists lose one Food yield. [ICON_BULLET]A small overall Gold percent penalty in all cities. Even the government donates a percentage to the Church. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Gold and Research. [ICON_BULLET]Religious and Spiritual technologies are discovered slower. The people are terrified of new religious thought. [ICON_BULLET]Non-state religions are significantly more difficult to spread. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are generated a little faster since those with great fervor for the religion are heavily motivated to serve. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are more stable with your religion. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you have spread your State Religion, you produce Great People faster. [ICON_BULLET]Allows the nation to produce Inquisitor units once technologically unlocked, that can remove all religions but the state religion in a city.
Zealous II

Negative Trait "Our gods are the ONLY gods and those who believe otherwise have earned their wrath and deserve to die!" This leader takes his faith to a dramatically unhealthy level of devotion. He likely suffers from cognitive dissonance as he uses his faith to justify all manner of violence and hatred, even though his faith may at its core promote peace and harmony. His people live in fear that if they are not devout, they will run afoul of harsh laws and penalties. But they live in even greater fear of the extremely demanding role they can fall into as religious leaders. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]The anarchy time to change religions is prohibitive. [ICON_BULLET]For every non-state religion in a city, you suffer from an additional unhappiness. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a penalty to diplomacy since other leaders fear, and find irritating, your desire to force your religious views on others. [ICON_BULLET]Lose a significant percentage amount of free experience on units trained in Holy Cities of non-state religions. Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]All combat capable units gain the Devotion II promotion, which gives a strong religious combat modifier, which is a combat modifier that applies as a benefit to your unit if the opponent unit is not of your religion, but as a penalty if they are. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]You earn Great People slower since your people spend much of their lives humbly, and fearfully, devoted to the faith. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are less stable with multiple religions present. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists lose one Commerce yield. [ICON_BULLET]An overall Gold percent penalty in all cities. Even the government donates a percentage to the Church. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Gold and Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Religious and Spiritual technologies are discovered slower. The people are terrified of new religious thought. [ICON_BULLET]Non-state religions are much more difficult to spread. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are generated a little faster since those with great fervor for the religion are heavily motivated to serve. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are more stable with your religion. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you have spread your State Religion, you produce Great People faster, enough to counter the usual penalty in all cities. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you have spread your State Religion, your units are trained a little faster. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you have spread your State Religion, buildings are constructed a bit faster. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a significant Experience point modifier boost in the Holy City of your state religion. [ICON_BULLET]Your state religion is easier to spread. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a happiness wherever you have access to the Incense resource.
Zealous III

Negative Trait "Our gods are the ONLY gods and those who believe otherwise have earned their wrath and deserve to die!" This leader takes his faith to a dramatically unhealthy level of devotion. He likely suffers from cognitive dissonance as he uses his faith to justify all manner of violence and hatred, even though his faith may at its core promote peace and harmony. His people live in fear that if they are not devout, they will run afoul of harsh laws and penalties. But they live in even greater fear of the extremely demanding role they can fall into as religious leaders. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]The anarchy time to change religions is completely prohibitive. [ICON_BULLET]For every non-state religion in a city, you suffer from two additional unhappiness. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a penalty to diplomacy since other leaders fear, and find irritating, your desire to force your religious views on others. [ICON_BULLET]Lose a significant percentage amount of free experience on units trained in Holy Cities of non-state religions. Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]All combat capable units gain the Devotion III promotion, which gives a strong religious combat modifier, which is a combat modifier that applies as a benefit to your unit if the opponent unit is not of your religion, but as a penalty if they are. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]You earn Great People slower since your people spend much of their lives humbly, and fearfully, devoted to the faith. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are less stable with multiple religions present. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists lose one Production yield. [ICON_BULLET]An overall Gold percent penalty in all cities. Even the government donates a percentage to the Church. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Gold and Espionage. [ICON_BULLET]Non-state religions are potentially impossible to spread. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are generated a little faster since those with great fervor for the religion are heavily motivated to serve. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are more stable with your religion. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you have spread your State Religion, you produce Great People faster, enough to counter the usual penalty in all cities. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you have spread your State Religion, your units are trained a little faster. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you have spread your State Religion, buildings are constructed a bit faster. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a significant Experience point modifier boost in the Holy City of your state religion. [ICON_BULLET]Your state religion is significantly easier to spread.

Negative Trait "Our gods are the ONLY gods and those who believe otherwise have earned their wrath and deserve to die!" This leader takes his faith to a dramatically unhealthy level of devotion. He likely suffers from cognitive dissonance as he uses his faith to justify all manner of violence and hatred, even though his faith may at its core promote peace and harmony. His people live in fear that if they are not devout, they will run afoul of harsh laws and penalties. But they live in even greater fear of the extremely demanding role they can fall into as religious leaders. Primary Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]The anarchy time to change religions is absolutely prohibitive and should only be done once and/or during Golden Ages. [ICON_BULLET]For every non-state religion in a city, you suffer from an additional unhappiness. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a strong penalty to diplomacy since other leaders greatly fear, and find irritating, your desire to force your religious views on others. [ICON_BULLET]Lose a significant amount of free experience on units trained in Holy Cities of non-state religions. [ICON_BULLET]When playing with the Religious Disabling option, all Non-State Religions are inactive, and, depending on civics, if they also bar Non-State Religions, their buildings are destroyed rather than simply disabled. Abilities: [ICON_BULLET]All combat capable units gain the Devotion promotion, which gives a strong religious combat modifier, which is a combat modifier that applies as a benefit to your unit if the opponent unit is not of your religion, but as a penalty if they are. Side Penalties: [ICON_BULLET]You earn Great People slower since your people spend much of their lives humbly, and fearfully, devoted to the faith. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are less stable with multiple religions present. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists lose one Food yield. [ICON_BULLET]A small overall Gold percent penalty in all cities. Even the government donates a percentage to the Church. [ICON_BULLET]Priest type City Specialists give an additional Gold, Research, Espionage AND Culture. [ICON_BULLET]Religious and Spiritual technologies are discovered slower. The people are terrified of new religious thought. [ICON_BULLET]Non-state religions are much more difficult to spread. Benefits: [ICON_BULLET]Great Military People are generated faster since those with great fervor for the religion are heavily motivated to serve. [ICON_BULLET]On the Revolutions Option, cities are more stable with your religion. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you have spread your State Religion, you produce Great People faster, enough to counter the penalty. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you have spread your State Religion, your units are trained a little faster. [ICON_BULLET]Wherever you have spread your State Religion, buildings are constructed a bit faster. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a significant Experience point modifier boost in the Holy City of your state religion. [ICON_BULLET]Your state religion is easier to spread. [ICON_BULLET]Allows the nation to produce Inquisitor units once technologically unlocked, that can remove all religions but the state religion in a city. [ICON_BULLET]Gain a happiness wherever you have access to the Incense resource.
Gains some benefits for the state religion but severe penalties for non-state religions.
TEXT.French: Bénéficie de certains avantages pour la religion d'État mais de lourdes sanctions pour les religions non étatiques.
